These sessions provide opportunities to meet with other parents and carers and social interaction with other children. They also help your child to develop language skills. They can be a special time to share with your child and are great fun!
No bookings are required. Come listen to stories and songs on a Saturday!
The session is aimed at toddlers, pre-school and kids up to grade prep/one.

ns0:venue.name: Wallan Library and Customer Service Centre

item.title: Studio Artists Show @ Old Post Office Seymour
item.description:
The Old Post Office Seymour is holding an exhibition of work by a group of Studio Artists. These professional artists have studios they open at specific times of the year, holding classes, demonstrate and judge in their field of expertise.
Exhibiting artists will include Ross Paterson, Agnes Szetey, Richard Chamerski, Kate Jenvey, Brett Jarrett and many others.
Studio artists working in other mediums include art glass worker Marina Villani of Myriad Glass Kilmore. Other well-known studio artists are the Beechworth Potters.
So many of the artists have studios, that it's impossible to see them all, displaying the art together gives the visitor one place to see whose work they like and to compare the diverse styles.
Over the sixteen days in November the Fine Art Gallery will be open every day and the many roses in the garden will also be in full bloom.

ns0:venue.name: Old Post Office Seymour, Fine Art Gallery & Licensed Restaurant

item.title: Frozen - Family Movie Night
item.description:
Come celebrate Children's Week with a Family Movie Night. Come ready in your PJ's to enjoy a screening of the popular Disney movie Frozen.
Movie will begin at 6pm. Don't forget to bring your pillows and blankets to get comfy. Enjoy a barbecue before the movie from 4-6pm, while having your face painted, be entertained by a balloon artist and find out about local information and services for children and families and of course there will be popcorn!!

address.address1: Cnr of Mollison and Pinniger St

item.title: Wellington Shire Children's Week Roadshow
item.description:
Wellington Children's Week 2014 will be focusing on more localities across the Wellington Shire through hosting a Children's Week Activity at various townships throughout the week.
This ensures that vulnerable children whose families may not have access to transport can still take part in the Children's Week celebrations.
UnitingCare Gippsland are working in partnership with the Wellington Shire Council. The theme for the activities will be 'Messy Play' and there will be many activities from mud, slime and worms!!

ns0:venue.name: Various Venues Across the Wellington Shire

item.title: Have a ball - tennis fun for kids
item.description:
As part of the Geelong Children's Week activities, Centre Court Indoor Tennis is offering a fun, interactive tennis based activity for pre-schoolers.
The Have a Ball session is perfect for small hands and active bodies. Racquets, kids afternoon tea provided.
This is a free event but bookings are essential.
Please arrive 10 minutes early.
To book call 5272 1760 or email details and contact number to info@geelongindoortennis.com.au

item.title: Belgrave South Community Market
item.description:
Held at the Community Hall, the Belgrave South Community Market has become a highlight in town since first opening.
On the first Sunday of each month, the market delivers a unique array of local handmade arts, crafts, designs, food and kids entertainment. It isn't just a market, but a place to gather, meet and greet, network and be inspired.
Save the date and help the market celebrate its first birthday. Be surprised with the range of kid's activities and entertainment including the sound of African drumming, jumping castle, magic and a lot more!
Bring the whole family and after you've finished at the market, take a scenic drive to Mt. Dandenong ranges for more beautiful views and nature appreciation.

item.title: Children's Week: The Ian Potter Foundation Children's Garden 10th Birthday
item.description:
Join the fun as the Royal Botanic Gardens celebrate the 10th birthday and re-opening of the beloved Ian Potter Foundation Children's Garden.
Explore the new Gathering Lawn and Desert Island and participate in free children's activities.
Time: 11am - 3pm
For more information call the Royal Botanic Gardens Visitor Centre on 03 9252 2300.

ns0:venue.name: The Ian Potter Foundation Children's Garden

image.altText: Children's Week: The Ian Potter Foundation Children's Garden 10th Birthday

item.title: Remembering Georges
item.description:
The Georges department store in Melbourne still holds a special place in the hearts and minds of Melburnians and Australians. It ran from 1880 through to the early 90s and was renowned the world over for its quality of merchandise and excellence in customer service.
The two George brothers who founded the store had, as their motto, 'what we do, we do well' and indeed they did as so many people to this day want to share their memories of Georges.
The book is a lavish production and includes interviews with fifty former Georges employees. The launch will definitely be a night to remember.

item.title: Connected Art Exhibition
item.description:
More than 150 new and emerging artists with a disability or experience of mental illness will showcase their work in the 12th State Trustees Connected Art Exhibition.
Curated by Andrew Chew from No Vacancy Gallery, Connected features artists selected from 600 entries across Victoria. The works display a range of artistic styles and mediums to showcase the diversity of artistic expression that can be explored through the lens of disability and mental illness.
State Trustees Connected Art Exhibition is sponsored by Maurice Blackburn, Ern Jensen Funerals, Thomson Real Estate, Noel Jones Real Estate and Nous Group.

item.title: Wandin Park Horse Trials
item.description:
The Wandin Park Horse Trials is on again in 2015! This year Wandin Park will be holding the Australian National Championships and this will bring all the top eventers from all over Australia.
With lots of shopping and entertainment over the whole weekend, bring a picnic or eat at the many catering options available.
A great weekend out for the whole family and it is free! Wandin Park is only an hour east of the Melbourne City in the heart of the Yarra Valley.

item.title: First View by Guy Morgan
item.description:
As the winner of the Cambridge Studio Gallery's Portrait Prize, Who is Looking at You, Guy Morgan's award is a solo exhibition, which will be his first in Melbourne.
Trained at St Martins School of Art and the London College of Painting, then completing a Masters of Studio Arts at Sydney College of Arts, Guy Morgan resumed painting after a 30-year career in advertising.
In the last 12 years, Morgan has developed a signature style that uses eye-droppers and highly liquid oil paint to create large, textured works. These can be best seen in his Nebula series (some of which will be shown in Melbourne).
Recently Morgan turned to portraiture to investigate the effects of distorted vision after suffering a detached retina in late 2011. Interesting and unconventional, the portrait series After Retinal Detachment has had great success, with works being hung in the Archibald 2013, the Mosman Prize 2012 & 2013, and the 2014 Percival Portrait Prize and 2014 Black Swan Prize for Portraiture. He was a double semi-finalist in the 2013 Moran Portrait Prize and shortlisted in the International Emerging Artist Award 2013.
First View is an opportunity for the Melbourne audience to see a selection of Guy Morgan's Portraits, Landscapes, Abstracts and Nebula Series. The diversity in his work brings many surprises but most impressive is the technique and its effect that can only be truly appreciated in the flesh - it's the best reason to come and see the show!
Linda Fleet, Deputy Director, Arts Victoria, Strategic Marketing & Communications will officially open the exhibition.

item.title: Free Concert at Melbourne Recital Centre: Jiangsu Folk Music Orchestra
item.description:
Music lovers of all ages are invited to a free concert at Melbourne Recital Centre by the internationally acclaimed Jiangsu Folk Music Orchestra.
The exclusive event, which will celebrate the 35th anniversary of Victoria's sister-state relationship with China's Jiangsu province, will feature traditional Jiangnan, Guangdong and Northern Chinese music by award winning performers.
The Victoria-Jiangsu sister-state partnership is Victoria's oldest and most enduring, as well as one of the first sister-state agreements between Australia and China. This concert is one of a series of events in Victoria and Jiangsu to mark the anniversary.
Tickets are free but registration is essential.

ns0:venue.name: Elisabeth Murdoch Hall, Melbourne Recital Centre

image.altText: The Jiangsu Folk Music Orchestra on stage holding their instruments
The Jiangsu Folk Music Orchestra on stage holding their instruments

item.title: Goanna Run
item.description:
The Goanna Run is a Rod Run and Kustom Kulture Festival. It embraces hot rods and custom type vehicles as well as the lifestyle aspects associated with this culture, including fashion, hair and makeup, art, music, dance and automotive styling.
On Saturday night Mildura City restaurants and traders are joining in and styling up providing a unique experience for visitors and locals alike.
On the Sunday at the Gateway Tavern you can take a leisurely stroll and get up close to the hot rods and talk to the owners.

item.title: Christina Thwaites – Body Transformations
item.description:
In a new body of work Christina Thwaites explores the female body and the transformations that it is able to undergo.
In the past Thwaites has often utilised old photographs for her painted works, attracted by the routinely serious, stiff and awkward nature of the sitters. One's awareness of their own body and its presentation to others is integral to these images and informs Thwaites painitngs.
In her current series of work Thwaites is again attracted to the body and the postures it assumes, this time however, her work has been heavily influence by her own body. Pregnant with her first child, the artist has discovered the elastic nature of the body and ones emotional state. Although not self-portraits the artists new works explore this transitory period and the physical and emotion relationships that are formed.

item.title: Hamish Carr – Perpetual Present
item.description:
Perpetual present is Hamish Carr's second solo exhibition with Anna Pappas Gallery. This recent body of work continues his interest in contemporary modes of communication specifically the creation of digital networks and virtual communities. Envisaging these interactions in formation has formed the basis to activate a reality specific to his practice.
The work for this exhibition has developed through the adaptation of etchings, digital technologies and topographic methods. These recent paintings employ both concerted and gestural applications of medium. This combination enables Carr to create a fluid and transient environment.
Hamish Carr was born in Rochester, New York and lives and works in Melbourne Australia. In 2009 he completed a Master of Fine Arts (Research) at the Victorian College of Arts, University of Melbourne. In 2011 he undertook an artist residency at Youkobo Art Space, Tokyo, and was a participating artist in the Australia-Japan Immanent Landscape Project at the Kurumaya Museum of Art, Oyama City Tochigi.
Carr has been the recipient of an Australia Council Grant (2012) and an Arts Victoria Cultural Exchange Grant (2011). He has been short-listed for numerous art prizes including the John Leslie Art Prize (2014), Tattersall's Landscape Art Prize (2014), the Fleurieu Art Prize (2013) Geelong Contemporary Art Prize (2012, 2008), and the R&M McGivern Art Prize (2012).
His work is included in the following public collections, Artbank, Bullseye Glass USA, Geelong Gallery and the Museum für Gestaltung, Zürich, Switzerland.
Opening drinks for the exhibition are on Thursday 9 October.

item.title: Field and Game Australia National Carnival
item.description:
The National Carnival is Field and Game Australia's (FGA) biggest event of the year. For two days, over 500 clay target shooters will come to the Seymour Field and Game range, in the scenic hills just outside of Avenel, to compete for a share in $60,000 in prizes.
The 2014 FGA National Carnival showcases some of the country's best shooters, with competitors travelling from all over the nation. Come along and see some of Australia's best take aim at the clay!
Bring the family and grab a BBQ lunch from Seymour Field and Game canteen, and visit the stalls from their sponsors and partners: Beretta, Winchester, GB Corsivia, Swarovski Optik and the Australian Deer Association, among others.
Spectator entry is free. Come along and watch the clays fly, and learn some more about this fun, sociable sport.

image.altText: Young Seymour Shooters at the 2012 National Carnival
Young Seymour Shooters at the 2012 National Carnival
Some of the Winners from the 2013 National Carnival
Some of the Winners from the 2013 National Carnival
Anthony Panetta, winner of the 2013 FGA National Carnival
Anthony Panetta, winner of the 2013 FGA National Carnival

item.title: Frankston Toy Library Family Fun Day
item.description:
Frankston Toy Library will open its doors in honour of Children's Week. Everyone is invited to come along and visit one of Australia's largest Toy Libraries. There will be lots of toys to play with, family friendly activities and cute animals to cuddle. All of the family friendly activities are free.
Family Fun Day will be held from 10am till 3pm on Friday October 24th 2014.

item.title: Carrum Regatta
item.description:
The Carrum Regatta will be held at Nagambie Lakes in North East Victoria. Jump in your car or hop on the train or bus because Nagambie is a region of wine, waterways, wetlands and wildlife only 90 minutes from Melbourne and only 40 minutes from Shepparton.
At its heart, the township of Nagambie offers a huge range of outdoor activities (both on and off the lake!) and is host to regular rowing regattas including the prestigious Victorian State Championships. If you're looking for a day trip, weekend escape, event location or tree change: here it is!

item.title: Wodonga Children's Fair
Hume Murray Farmers Market - Growing for Life
item.description:
As part of Wodonga Children's Week 2014, there will be hands-on introduction to planting seeds for food and cooking healthy foods. Demonstration and some participation and, for extra excitement, a snake handler to add the chilli of excitement.
Venue: Gateway Village, Lincoln Causeway Time: 8am to noon Fee: Free Enquiries: info@hmfb.org

item.title: Children's Week - The Great Wall of Flowers
item.description:
Children from the Ararat region will learn how to create colourful origami flowers that will ultimately form a vibrant 3D mural depicting a local, springtime scene.
The mural design, by local artist Mark Hughes, will be 'coloured in' with the children's flowers covering the entire surface, resulting in a spectacular and joyful celebration of springtime in our region.
Origami Flower making Stations with instructions and coloured paper supplied, will be set up in the Ararat Regional Library, Ararat Gallery, Golden Gateway Festival Children's Day, local Primary Schools and After School Care groups.

ns0:venue.name: Various Venues in Ararat Rural City Region

image.altText: Children's Week 2014 - 'The Great Wall of Flowers'

item.title: Preschool story time for three to five year olds at Beaumaris Library
item.description:
Come and celebrate Children's Week 2014 with a special preschool story time session that is aimed at children three to five years of age. This session will be fun, interactive and entertaining.
Preschool story time for three to five year olds will be held from 10.30am to 11.15am at the Beaumaris Library.

item.title: Baby Rhyme Time for 0 to 18 month olds at Brighton Library
item.description:
Come and celebrate Children's Week 2014 with a special Baby Rhyme Time for zero to 18 month olds. This session will be fun, interactive and entertaining for the little ones.
Baby Rhyme Time for zero to 18 month olds will be held from 10.30am to 10.50am at the Brighton Library.

item.title: Nagambie Lakes Community Market
item.description:
The Nagambie Lakes Community Market has a fantastic atmosphere with regular entertainment a great mix of quality stalls.
The market, now located on the south side of the lake at Blayney reserve offers some of the best views in Victoria!
Held on the first Saturday of the month, the market offers a make, bake, sew and grow theme that insists on a level of Australian content and local produce.
Regular stalls include:
- Fresh local vegetables and produce - Goats milk products, olive oil soaps, candles and free range eggs - Leather products, hats and socks - Garden ornaments and plants - Bejewelled by Sam - handmade beaded jewellery - Chel Rafter Photography and Gifts - Bec's Bargains - children's toys and tech accessories - Handsewn by Helen - Mad Cow Cakes
Take a drive to Nagambie, less than 90 mins from Melbourne and centrally located. The market is rapidly growing and has lots to offer with off street parking at Buckley Park and stunning views over the lake.
Central Victoria's only absolute water-front market.

item.title: Warlayirti and Garnkiny
item.description:
RMIT Gallery presents two important Aboriginal art exhibitions - Warlayirti: The Art of Balgo, and Garnkiny: Constellations of Meaning.
Warlayirti: The Art of Balgo examines the aesthetic divergences and vibrancy that distinguishes the art of Balgo and the importance of Christianity to the Balgo community as a means of cross cultural communication.
Garnkiny: Constellations of Meaning includes works by Gija artists, both past and present, and explores aspects of the rich and significant story Garnkiny Ngarranggarni (Moon Dreaming) which takes place on Yarin Country in Darrajayin, between Warmun and Halls Creek, in Western Australia.
See website for more information on publc programs for these events.

item.title: Second Tuesday Reading Circle at Library at The Dock
item.description:
Share your love of reading and discover some great reads in time for summer.
Unlike a book club, a reading circle does not set a book to read. Each person discusses what they are currently reading or a book that has changed their life. Whether a good novel, a collection of poetry, your favourite play or a biography, however you reacted to it, the Second Tuesday Reading Circle wants to hear about it!
The Reading Circle at Library at The Dock is held on the second Tuesday of the month.

item.title: Perception
item.description:
The deceptive interplay of memory and perception is the foundation of Kat Teede’s current exhibition, Perception.
Through duplicitous portrait photography and suspended installation, the artist delves into the multiple truths that present themselves within our memories.
Conditioned by a lapse of time, memories mask and reveal our pasts and become subject to deterioration or transformation, thereby altering our perceptions. Atmospheric monochromatic portraits depict this lapse of time and resultant shift. Installations of jigsaw pieces further portray how memories connect and disconnect in time.
Tracing time and memory, Kat Teede creates a minimalist and haunting aesthetic in Perception that draws the viewer into an ambiguous world. Opening night will be accompanied by an evocative cello performance by Melbourne based cellist Francesca Mountford, drawing the viewer further into this world.
Perception is supported by the City of Melbourne 2014 Arts Grants Program.
Opening night Wednesday 15 October, 6–9pm

item.title: Oktoberfest at Munich Brauhaus
item.description:
Following in the Bavarian footsteps, festivities will begin from Sunday 19th September as the newly opened Munich Brauhaus hosts the biggest and most authentic Bavarian celebrations in the Southern Hemisphere.
For six exciting weeks, venues will be encouraging guests to don their lederhosen, sample exclusive limited edition Oktoberfest biers, enjoy traditional Oktoberfest food and help them hunt for the Prince and Princess of Oktoberfest.
So join in the Oktoberfest celebrations at Munich Brauhaus, South Wharf!

item.title: Melbourne Adventure Travel Expo
item.description:
Whether you're a first time backpacker or seasoned traveller, the Melbourne Adventure Travel Expo brings together tour operators, accommodation networks and employment and volunteering agencies to help you choose your own adventure.
Whether it be inbound to the Land Downunder, or outbound to some wild and amazing destinations, tour operators will be out in force at Melbourne's only Adventure Travel Expo.
With STA, Britbound and BBM Live as our sponsors and with a variety of travel talks from what to do, where to go, how to save cash or simply where to stay, you'd be mad not to see what's in store!
Entry is free AND there will be a massive prize which could really get you started on that adventure you have always dreamed of.
Saturday: 12pm - 6pm Sunday: 11am - 5pm

item.title: Tasmanian Driftwood jewellery
item.description:
Bini Gallery will be featuring a new beautiful collection of driftwood jewellery pieces by Tasmania-based jewellery maker Linda van Niekerk.
These works present simple and sculptural pieces of Tasmania wilderness driftwood and invite the wearer to appreciate the natural beauty of a precious resource.
For more information, please see website.

image.altText: Gentle Ripple Adrft by Linda van Niekerk
Gentle Ripple Adrft by Linda van Niekerk

item.title: The Wimmera and The Great War
item.description:
The Wimmera and The Great War is a museum style exhibition that commemorates the centenary of World War I.
A small brown leather diary lies open, cascading out is a monographed handkerchief, small black and white photographs of friends and family, a leave pass carried since his training days, a letter from his mother and a pressed leaf inscribed: from Mollie. Carried by a young soldier from Lubeck, lost on the field of France when only 21, these personal mementos are now treasured markers of one family's sacrifice.
It is the way that the events and effects of The Great War were recorded and shared within the community that is at the heart of this exhibition. Through letters and cards that crossed oceans a century ago, objects of daily life from the battlefield, and recordings of life on the home front, pause to reflect on the events that changed the region and nation.
These stories, mementos, and signifiers of commemoration have been drawn from the Horsham, Natimuk and Dimboola Historical Societies, and Warracknabeal and District Historical Society; Horsham, Natimuk and Warracknabeal Returned Servicemen Leagues; and responses to the public call out that unearthed numerous family collections.
The Wimmera and The Great War records, memorialises and celebrates over 115 servicemen and women and the communities that supported them. This sample of the regions participation is a starting point for everyone to reflect on family, community, and service over the coming four years as the centenary of The Great War is marked.

item.title: Children's Week - MikMaks music group
item.description:
Come and enjoy the fun at one of the many events held in Glen Eira during Children's Week, with The MikMaks.
The MikMaks are one of Australia's most popular children's entertainment groups and will be playing at the Carnegie Library as part of Council's Springtime Music Festival. The group will play a range of music perfect for children of all ages.
Time: 3pm to 5pm

item.title: Children's Week - Children’s day
item.description:
Come and enjoy the fun at one of the many events held in Glen Eira during Children's Week.
Children's Day, the most fun-filled day of Children's Week, with a range of activities including a mobile petting farm, balloon artists, stilt walkers, an art show, craft activities and a sing-a-long with Miles of Smiles.
Time: 9.30am to 12.30pm

item.title: Children's Week - Caring for the environment
item.description:
Come and enjoy the fun at one of the many events held in Glen Eira during Children's Week in caring for the environment.
Learn more about living sustainably in Glen Eira with a recycling display, seed planting demonstrations and an exciting scavenger hunt throughout the park.
Time: 10am to 12pm

item.title: I spy with my Heide eye…
item.description:
I spy with my Heide eye is a Children's Week event presented by Heide Museum of Modern Art in partnership with the Victorian Department of Education and Early Childhood Development.
Students follow the leader to explore & compare indoor & outdoor art works in the Heide exhibitions & sculpture park. Work with a Barking Spider Visual Theatre artist & Heide educator to discover enjoyable ways to use artworks as a catalyst for imaginative inquiry and art.
The 90 minute program is suitable for kinder to year 6 student groups only, with a maximum size group 30 students - minimum 10 students per group.
To apply for your preferred date please submit this completed booking form to education@heide.com.au You will be advised via return confirmation email within three business days if your booking is successful. (Booking close 3, October 2014)
Available sessions:
- Tue 21/10/2014 10am or 12.30pm - Wed 22/10/2014 10am or 12.30pm - Thu 23/10/2014 10am or 12.30pm - Fri 24/10/2014 10am or 12.30pm
In addition to the social learning that occurs in museum learning experiences this program also meets the following curriculum areas:
AUSVELS: Physical, personal and social learning, communication, creativity. Personal learning, thinking processes, civics and citizenship.
ARTS DOMAIN: Creating and making. Exploring and responding
Students will benefit in the program in a number of ways, some of which are, access multiple intelligences, develop higher thinking skills, build self esteem, gain positive emotional responses to learning and engage through a variety of learning styles: looking, listening, sharing and creating.

image.altText: I spy with my Heide eye…
I spy with my Heide eye…

item.title: Open House Geelong 2014
item.description:
Open House Geelong is a not-for-profit association run by a dedicated group of volunteers set up to hold an event that provides the public a free and rare opportunity to discover a hidden wealth of architectural and historic buildings in Geelong. The buildings reflect the rich past, celebrate the present and offer insights into the future of Geelong.
Their well-informed volunteers are available at each of the buildings to discuss the significance of these buildings within a Geelong context and contribute to visitors' experience of both the buildings and the city.
Geelong held its first Open House Geelong in 2012, with over 3000 visits. Don't miss the opportunity to participate, or even volunteer, in Open House Geelong 2014. Put the date in your diary.
For more information (including volunteering opportunities) and a building list please visit their website.
item.ns0:organiser: Open House Geelong Board and Karina Haley (Project Manager)

item.title: VicHealth's Walk to School
item.description:
VicHealth's Walk to School is taking place this October. Walk to School is a fun, free and family-friendly campaign that encourages primary-school children and their parents to swap the road for the pavement and build healthy habits for life.
What? VicHealth is inviting families with primary-school aged children to walk to school every day in October.
When? Walk to School starts on the first day of term 4 (October 6) and runs for the full month of October.
How? Victorian schools and families can register their participation online.
Why? Walking to school is a great way for parents and children to get active and spend more quality time together. There are also great incentives and prizes to be won.

item.title: Picnic In The Vineyard with Live Music
item.description:
Come and enjoy Ringer Reef Wineries beautiful setting with live music and Picnic in the Vineyard on Saturday afternoon.
From 12pm onwards, guests are welcome to bring their own chairs, rugs, balls, games and sit out on our terrace and lawn and enjoy the tunes, wine and views!
Music from 2pm until 5pm. Local musicians playing of different weekends. lease see our website for more details.
This is a free event. With local produce nibbles, Bruce on the barbecue and Annie's seasonal platters in Cellar Door, you're sure to have a ball relaxing or grooving on the lawn. Bring your own nibbles are allowed but no BYO alcohol!.
Ringer Reef Winery look forward to seeing you at this fun event!

image.altText: Picnic In The Vineyard with Live Music
Picnic In The Vineyard with Live Music

item.title: Violet Town Community Market
item.description:
Come down to the Violet Town Community Market and browse 250 stalls of fresh produce, arts, crafts, jewellery, wine tastings, plants, tools, furniture and more.
Wander the relaxed market atmosphere of one of Victoria's premier country markets. Fill your basket with fresh bread, tasty cheeses and organic fruits and vegetables.
Relax and enjoy live music, hot food and great coffee.
Founded in 1978 this thriving community market supports local groups and is renowned for its focus on sustainable living principles - remember to bring your own bags.
Entry is free however a gold coin donation to a local organisation of the month would be welcomed.
Dogs are not allowed on the market site.
The Market site is a Smoke Free Zone. Your cooperation is appreciated.

item.title: Chewing The Scene: Playwrights' Workshop
item.description:
In these intensive, four-hour workshops for budding playwrights, Victorian theatre professionals will deliver the insider information on how to get your script off the slush pile.
The behind-the-scenes workshops also look at script development, writing for companies, critiquing your own work and developing your craft.
For more information, please see website.

item.title: Growing Friends spring plant sale
item.description:
Come along and select from a range of plants, many of which you’ll find growing in the Australian Garden. Some of which are hard to find but have been propagated from the very plants in the Australian Garden! Free entry, plant prices will vary.
Presented by the Friends of the Royal Botanic Gardens Cranbourne.
10am - 4pm.
Tel: 03 5990 2200 for more information.

address.address1: Cnr Ballarto Road and Botanic Drive

item.title: Children's Week in Stonnington
item.description:
The Children's Week event is an annual event providing the children with an opportunity to highlight and develop their knowledge of their community by creating a collection of digital images.
The project will focus on three key themes. Sustainable living, Places we visit and People who are important to us. A range of local School age, Pre School and Childcare services have been invited to participate and submit the photographs which will story board and showcase how they interpret these topics.
The images will be collated and then displayed during Children's Week 18 - 26 October 2014 on the City of Stonnington's website and in public spaces within the City of Stonnington.

item.title: Brookside Twilight Market
item.description:
Enjoy an entertaining evening at the Brookside Twilight Market, including over 100 unique market stalls, entertainment, food and children's activities! The Twilight Market will take place in the gym and surrounds of the Brookside P-9 College in Caroline Springs.
The market will be lots of fun for the whole family. Whilst you are wandering around a huge variety of both indoor and outdoor stalls, your family will be entertained with student performances and entertainment in our kid's zone. Come spend the entire evening enjoying edible delights from the lolly shop, juice bar, ice cream van, barbecue and other food vans.
This will be a huge local event which has been made possible with the help of our Collaborators (Brookside College and Brookside Pre-School) and Sponsors (Woolworths Watergardens, The West Waters Hotel and Entertainment Complex, Kings Swim Centre Caroline Springs, Masters - Burnside and Coates Hire - Brooklyn).

item.title: Children's Week in Banyule
item.description:
Banyule City Council is proud to display a new Children's Week project: One Hundred Faces throughout Children's Week in selected community spaces.
One Hundred Faces is a project which reflects this year's Children's Week theme "the right to speak and be heard" and involves 100 local primary school children. Digital and visual displays of children's words and photographs will be showcased at the following venues: WaterMarc, Greensborough, Rosanna and Ivanhoe libraries, Banyule City Council customer service foyers (Greensborough, Rosanna and Ivanhoe).
For more information on the One Hundred Faces project and other Children's Week events running in Banyule please visit the website.

item.title: Polish Festival
item.description:
Spend a day experiencing the colours, sounds and aromas of Poland at the Polish Festival 2014 at Fed Square.
Victoria has the largest concentration of Polish born people and their descendants in Australia. Join them for a huge program of celebrations and activities that showcases the very best of their unique culture right here in the heart of Melbourne.
Enjoy live music performances, traditional dances, special acts and entertainment running all day on the main stage. Take a stroll down River Terrace and explore stalls selling a variety of Polish crafts, artworks, books, jewellery and other trinkets. You can also taste some of the finest polish treats with a delectable array of authentic foods on offer.
Kids can get creative with arts and crafts activities running all day at the Kid's Stop, while adults head to the beer garden to relax and sample from the world-class ale on offer.

item.title: Climate Watch Walk
item.description:
Be a Climate Watcher! Join a guide at the Royal Botanic Gardens and a ClimateWatch Scientist on this free guided walk.
During the walk, record features of specific plants and animals in the Gardens. These observations will become part of a database that helps scientists see what impact climate change is having on particular species, and therefore inform Australia's response to a changing climate.

item.title: Spring discovery tour
item.description: Discover the history, cultural significance and stunning beauty of the Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne. Take a walk among the fresh green leaves of spring on this free guided tour of the Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne with one of their knowledgeable guides. You can also enjoy a peaceful punt on the Ornamental Lake or relax at one of the cafes, The Terrace or Jardin Tan.

item.title: Sunday Session at Barney Allen's
item.description:
Barney Allen's is a St Kilda bar that is old style St Kilda, with live music every Sunday afternoon.
Its laid back, comfortable and reasonably priced. There is plenty of food options whether it be smaller tapas style dishes or burgers or hearty main courses.
There are comfortable couches down the back, an outside area or plenty of bar stools to prop up at the bar with.
Sunday Sessions are free entry and the perfect way to while away the end of the weekend.

item.title: Organ &... Symphonic Band
item.description:
The musical might of Australia's military will be on display as the Air Force Band performs a Christmas-tinged program.
Favourites by Richard Strauss and Edward Elgar will be matched with lesser known works by Percy Grainger and Kenneth Alford. A highlight of this free concert will be the world premiere of a commissioned work by Melbourne composer Stuart Greenbaum.
The Air Force Band has a proud history dating more than 60 years. Its mission is to promote and enhance the image and culture of the Air Force through music and ceremony. Under the sixth director of music, Squadron Leader Mathew Shelley, the band regularly gives free public concerts as well as supporting the armed services both in Australia and abroad.

item.title: Halloween Fright Night – Dis–organ–eyes
item.description:
The Night Terrors launch Pavor Nocturnus, a vinyl release (Dual Planet/Twisted Nerve Australia) that combines Grand Organ with theremin, drums and synthesisers. Quiet drops of sepulchral voltage and cacophonous whirls of intricate acoustic phenomena intermingle to prise open the maddening space between sentience and expiration. Miles Brown, Damian Coward and Sarah Lim combine to create a euphorically terrifying dream sequence, just perfect for Halloween.
Students from RMIT's Sculpture, Sound and Spatial Practice course will add to the drama with a series of short premieres in which the Grand Organ is triggered by computers. Pushing the boundaries beyond the humanly possible, expect to hear profound sub-bass, rippling sonic textures, and a précis of Melbourne's new sound of the decade ahead.

item.title: Garage Sale Trail at the Library at The Dock
item.description:
On Saturday 25 October there will be garage sales happening all around the City of Melbourne, including at The Dock outside Library at The Dock in Docklands, and Boyd Community Hub in Southbank.
Garage Sale Trail is for households, community groups, schools, charities, makers and creators. So whether you have a yarn to tell or some yarn to sell, absolutely everyone can get involved. By getting involved, you'll have a chance to spring clean your home or office, reduce waste that might otherwise go into landfill, as well as make some money and meet neighbours.

item.title: Percy Masters: A bonafide Gippsland Treasure
item.description:
The paintings of Percy Masters (1893- 1998) are greatly admired for their charm as much as their historical value.
Born in Walhalla in 1893, Masters spent a lifetime painting his memories of a youth growing up in the township. Today his works form an important account of the rise and fall of this early gold-mining town (which would later rise again).
Walhalla 150 Years marks 150 years of the town's foundation, and 100 years since the closure of the Long Tunnel Mine.

item.title: Sisely Estate Celebrates Spring
item.description:
A small family vineyard in the beautiful Yarra Valley will open its doors for three Sundays this Spring, on the second Sunday in September, October and November.
It's an opportunity to taste their range, including the Reserve; of full flavoured Preservative Free and Vegan Friendly wines and talk to the Winemaker. Nibble on cheese and biscuits whilst admiring the wonderful views across to Mount Dandenong and see the alpacas roaming around.
For more information on October and November dates for this event, please contact Sisely Estate or check their web or Facebook pages.

item.title: Avenel Make it, Bake it, Grow it Market
item.description:
Traditional country market featuring local produce, plants, food and wine, kids activities, great coffee, community BBQ, live entertainment. Great day out for all the family.
Market is held second Sunday of every Month, so come and join in the fun of the fair and restock the pantry and enjoy a month of delicious deliciacies.

image.altText: Avenel Make it, Bake it, Grow it Market
Avenel Make it, Bake it, Grow it Market

item.title: A Secret Place
item.description:
If you fancy a 1950s New York vibe on your Saturday night, complete with romantic and spirited jazz, ice-cold cocktails and even a cigar room, you will want to book a table at A Secret Place, a members-only club that now opens to the public only on Saturday nights.
This Saturday features the Connie Lansberg Quartet.

item.title: The Australian Red Cross in the Great War
item.description:
Celebrate 100 years of the Red Cross in Australia with this stunning photographic exhibition.
Featured in the exhibition are striking images from the Australian Red Cross archives – most on public display for the first time – that convey the nerve-centre of the Australian Red Cross in Melbourne. The exhibition also looks at Australian Red Cross fund-raising efforts in Victoria and their compassionate projects at home and abroad.
Presented by the Royal Historical Society of Victoria.

item.title: Page Not Found exhibition
item.description:
The famous Sands & McDougall Victorian Directory was the internet of its day, a vast web of information compiling the names of Melburnian householders in enormous annually published volumes. Today, its 117-year publishing legacy - and the great beauty of the huge books - is immense.
Founded in 1857, the Directory of residents, trades and streets lasted until 1974. It remains much-used by historians and genealogists - but also contains many lost and unexpected treasures. Page Not Found explores how each Directory is a story of lost Melbourne, for every year's volume records the massive changes this city has undergone.
The exhibition is curated by arts journalist Andrew Stephens and features illustrations by Oslo Davis.

item.title: Carlton Italian Festa
item.description:
Carlton Italian Festa is a fun free day of activities celebrating the food, art, music and culture of Italy!
It is about bringing all Melburnians - young, old and in between - together in the heart of Melbourne's Italian precinct to celebrate all things Italian.
The day will feature music, dance and comedy performances along with cooking demonstrations, sporting and children's activities. There will also be lots of delicious Italian food and drinks available for purchase.

item.title: Yarra Valley Spring Festival
item.description:
The Yarra Valley Spring Festival is a family friendly festival with unique products and stalls.
With gorgeous clothes and crafts, beautiful food and wares, free kids activities, live music, rides and more, it's a great day out for the whole family.
Located in Seville - a small town in the heart of the Yarra Valley - take a drive out and enjoy some organic foods, local produce and unique giftwares.
The Yarra Valley Spring Festival is a community run event - all proceeds go back to benefit the community.
Take a drive out to the small town of Seville and have a lovely day enjoying all we have to offer.

item.title: Tatong Village Market
item.description:
Tatong Village Village Market, located in the grounds of the historic Tatong Tavern Hotel, provides an excellent country setting for a local food sampling and gathering experience, offering the perfect start to a weekend of local sports, a visit to the slopes or whiling away time in front of open fires enjoying local wine, great food and good company.
The Tatong Village Market will showcase an array of fresh produce, food and wine in addition to a country breakfast fit for a king! Produce to be expected includes fresh fruit and vegetables, free range pork, olives and oil, free range eggs, walnuts, including pickled walnuts, beef, mutton, plants and herbs, organic bread, culinary rose product including home made Turkish delight and quince jelly, fine tea, cakes, biscuits, tarts, homemade soaps, relishes, chutneys and wine produced in nearby Samaria and Lima.

item.title: Stitching Stories Quilt Exhibition
item.description:
Contemporary Art and Traditional Quilts featuring diverse quilting techniques and each with its own unique story to tell on display in this gorgeous array of quilts. Quilt exhibitions are usually about the quilt. Today, quilts are not only valued for comfort but have become a means of expression as a form of textile art. This exhibition is about the stories of the individual quilt maker.
Eleven outstanding Victorian Quilters display their top creations - ranging from the most traditional through to the most contemporary, in this wonderful Collection of 'the art of the quilt'.
Linda Bear, Lesley Goddard, Anne Sushames and Toni Warrell work in the traditional style of patterns & imagery. Dijanne Cevaal, Felicity Griffin Clark, Susan Mathews, Sarah Louise Ricketts, Robina Summers, Olga Walters and Fiona Wright are amongst Australia's foremost Contemporary Art Quilters. They have exhibited internationally many times and their quilts are in numerous Australian and overseas collections.
Stitching Stories is an inspiring exhibition which shows how beautifully quilts can tell stories through stitching.

item.title: Tricky Traps
item.description:
The incredible design and engineering feat of the spiders' web will become an object of wonder and inspiration when ArtPlay is transformed by a delicate tangle of webs with the installation of Tricky Traps. Visitors will be encouraged to reconsider the workings of these tiniest of creatures that help make the amazing world that we live in. Carefully wander through this tricky environment and find a space to create your own artwork. Make an insect pod from string, do a drawing or craft a spider sculpture.
Age: 4 to 12 years
Free, no bookings required
All children must be accompanied by an adult.

item.title: Tape It!
item.description:
Imagine a drawing that has become bored of paper and wandered off the page in search of new adventure. If this sounds appealing, drop into ArtPlay for Tape It!, a collaborative, room-size, expanded drawing made of lines of colourful electrical tape. Everyone of all ages can contribute to the artwork which may expand in many creative directions and dimensions.
There will also be some very simple rules to guide those who would like to learn about generative art. All materials will be provided. The drawing will run most of the day that is, until the un-drawing stage begins! Sometimes deconstruction is just another stage of creation. Find out how when you come along to Tape It!
Age: Family
Free, no bookings required.

item.title: Yarra Primary School Fete
item.description:
Yarra Primary School's fete promises to be bigger than ever this year! Come along and enjoy all the fun of live music and acts, great food and drinks, rides and entertainment, for the whole family!
Simply because Yarra Primary believe a great fete should not only have good activities and good food, but also, good music.
This fantastic event is about celebrating and showcasing our wonderful school and bringing people together, especially those from the local community, for an experience extravaganza of fabulous food, drink and music along with picking up bargains from pre-loved books, or new hand made items from our craft market stalls and delicious organic produce from the kitchen garden.
Anyone who wishes to have a great community day out is more than welcome along.
For the children or young-at-heart, there are rides, giant chess, splash dunker, fairy floss, face painting, woodworking, kid's craft, bush baby animals, and much, much more!
The money raised from the Fete goes directly to the education of the children at Yarra Primary School.
Like many small schools we rely on additional funding to maximise the learning opportunities for our children and our fete is the school's major annual fundraising event.
Although the day is primarily a community building event, with the help and generosity of local businesses and community, the funds raised on the day goes directly to the educational needs of the children through extracurricular program upgrades, otherwise unfunded, such as Kitchen Garden Program, ICT (Information & Communication Technology) equipment, and purchasing the latest literacy assisted learning sets.

item.title: Thessaloniki & Melbourne Sister City Festival
item.description:
Thessaloniki Association's Annual Festival in the centre of Melbourne celebrates the 30 year sister city relationship between the two cities.
The Thessaloniki Association's Annual Festival in the heart of Melbourne is presented in co-operation with the Hellenic Australian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (HACCI). Attendees of the festival include the Mayor of Thessaloniki Mr G. Boutaris, the Lord Mayor of Melbourne Mr R. Doyle, and several MPs from Victoria and Thessaloniki.
There'll be plenty of Greek food, a food exhibition, performances, business delegations and lots of fun. Cooks from Greece will demonstrate their cooking skills and offer Greek food tasting. Businesses from Greece and Melbourne will present their wares. Plus there will be stalls, performers, dancers and musicians to entertain the crowds.
Program starting at 1pm to be distributed on the day, speeches at 4pm.

item.title: Horsham Car & Bike Show
item.description:
The Horsham Car and Bike Show will hold it's annual Show and Shine event in March Labour Day weekend.
Event organisers raise funds for the Wimmera Against Cancer in Kids group, which assists families who are having to deal with the trauma of having a child with cancer.
For more information, please see the website.

item.title: National Gemboree
item.description:
All roads leads to Horsham Victoria during the 2015 National Gemboree. The Horsham & District Lapidary Club will be hosting the 51st National Gem and Mineral Show at the Wimmera Events Centre during Easter 2015.
Come and see beautiful minerals like fluorite specimen on display along with a range of gems, fossils, jewellery, beads, meteorites, craft tools and equipment, there is sure to be something to bring a smile to anyone's face.
This amazing show will attract visitors from around Australia and overseas. Visitors will be able to browse or buy from a huge range of gems, minerals, jewellery, beads just to name a few.
View demonstrations of a wide range of lapidary and jewellery crafts, see the experts first hand demonstrating their amazing skills.
It is with great pleasure that Horsham Rural City Council welcomes all exhibitors and visitors from far and wide to the 2015 Gemboree National Gem and Mineral Show.

item.title: Pamela Gordon Art Exhibition
item.description: This Exhibition at the Mont De Lancey Historic property in the Yarra Valley covers a diverse range of Pamela's work. She believes passionately that art enriches our lives. Mainly a pastel artist she also works with acrylics, oils and watercolour. She finds inspiration for her paintings in her local surroundings in the Yarra Valley and from holiday destinations. Pamela never travels without a sketch book. One of her favourite subjects is vineyards, where she has been allowed to paint on site. Pamela utilizes strong colour, crisp line to convey the mastery of her mediums. Open every day except Monday and Tuesday

item.title: Buninyong Good Life Festival
item.description:
The Buninyong Good Life Festival is a community focused annual celebration of ideas, interests and what it means to live The Good Life! It aims to promote awareness of DonateLife Victoria while encouraging and supporting other local causes.
With a focus on health, the 2014 festival will once again be organising The King Of The Mountain Fun Run/Walk as well as incorporating a Health Hub and other interactive activities.
The festival is a free family fun day full of entertainment, market stalls, children's precinct with pantomime performances and craft activities and much, much more - something for everyone!

item.title: Children's Week - Aussie Backyard Bird Count
item.description:
The Aussie Backyard Bird Count is Australia's first nationwide bird survey! Join thousands of people as they get to know their local birds during BirdLife Australia's Bird Week (20-26 October 2014) and help them discover how birds are faring.
All it takes it 15 minutes in your backyard, neighbourhood park or favourite green patch to be a part of this exciting citizen science event!

item.title: Soul Food
item.description:
Soul Food is a unique monthly event held at the State Library of Victoria. It provides an opportunity to unite in a tranquil environment and reflect on inspiring themes and common threads that tie us all together.
This relaxed gathering features live music, audio-visual pieces and readings from faiths and philosophers, authors, leaders and indigenous cultures from all over the world.
The purpose of Soul Food is to inspire us to transform peoples lives, peoples neighbourhoods and communities, with actions that promote the unity and betterment of society.
Soul Food is a free community event open to all.

item.title: Horsham Triathlon
item.description:
The 2015 Horsham Triathlon will be held on Saturday 14th February, with the junior "Come and Try" event held first followed by the senior event. Mark the date in your calendar now!!
The event will once again be part of the Telstra Store Rural Tri Series, covering five rural triathlons to be held at Benalla, Echuca-Moama, Albury-Wodonga, Horsham and Shepparton.
More details later in 2014

item.title: Hamilton Quilters: Two Colour Harmony
item.description:
There has been a renewed interest in craft and needlework in recent years as traditional arts and crafts enjoy a revival with a younger generation.
Quilts in particular are familiar objects, yet every stitch has the power to carry a range of stories and histories. These works can often hold immense family value, lovingly handed down through the generations.
The Hamilton Quilters have been delighting Western Victoria with their dedication, skill and creativity with this popular medium for over 30 years. This exhibition will mark the group's 16th biennial exhibition in the gallery with a variety of techniques and ideas on display themed around 'Two Colour Harmony'.

item.title: William Hogarth: Characters and Caricatures
item.description:
William Hogarth was most famously known for his biting commentary on 18th century manners and morals. A controversial and individualistic character he was driven by a sense for justice and missed no chance to assert his opinion even if he meant he got into a quarrel with his contemporaries.
This selection of prints from the Gallery's holdings looks at his satire and preoccupation with caricature in his work.
The term caricature is defined as a 'grotesque representation of a person by the exaggeration of the characteristic traits in picture, writing or mime'. We will not offer the writing or the mime but the exhibition will consist of some entertaining pictures!

item.title: Hamilton Tops 2014
item.description:
Now in its twelfth year, Hamilton Tops 2014 features work created by local VCE students undertaking studies in Studio Arts and Visual Communication and Design.
The exhibition highlights Hamilton Art Gallery's strong commitment and support of arts education in the region and celebrates the talents and achievements of the local youth. Audiences are provided with an insight into the ideas and influences that inspire arts students.
Work is selected from secondary schools in the Shire: Baimbridge College, Hamilton and Alexandra College, Monivae College, Good Shepherd College and Balmoral Community College.

item.title: Illumination: The art of Philip Wolfhagen
item.description:
This exhibition Illumination: The art of Philip Wolfhagen is the first major survey of this Tasmanian artist.
A landscape artist, Wolfhagen is a master of creating works of art that capture changing light and mood, temperature and atmosphere. To view his paintings is to be seduced by the fleeting elements of weather and the ever-changing qualities of nature. It is this ethereal quality that makes his art so appealing to collectors and art galleries both in Australia and overseas.
The exhibition will travel to 6 other venues across four states and the ACT.

image.altText: ILLUMINATION: The art of Philip Wolfhagen
ILLUMINATION: The art of Philip Wolfhagen

item.title: Transcendence: Photographs by David Stephenson
item.description:
David Stephenson has photographed a range of subjects in countries around the world, including landscapes, skyscapes, cityscapes and cathedral ceilings.
Stephenson uses photography to explore abstract, intangible themes including time, mortality and spirituality. While the immediate subject of his works has varied, the underlying themes and ideas within his photographs have remained consistent.

item.title: The Fabulous Shaw Bequest: Revisited
item.description:
General consensus was that the superb showing of a selection of works from the Shaw Bequest organised in 2013 was on for too short a time so we are revisiting one of the greatest gifts received by the arts in Australia's history and the core of the Hamilton collection.
For more information, please see website.

item.title: Nanneella Community Clearing Sale & Auction
item.description:
Turn your Spring Clean into cash! Time to clean out those cupboards and sheds and you may be surprised by how much these unwanted items are worth!
If you are a collector or bargain hunter then Nanneella is the place for you! With a whole reserve of sale items to choose from you might just find what you didn't know you had been looking for!
Enjoy catching up with friends and neighbours in friendly, country atmosphere.

item.title: The Art of Botanical Illustration
item.description:
The Friends of the Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne present the Twelfth Art of Botanical Illustration Exhibition, featuring over 150 works of Botanic Art by leading artists from Australia and overseas.
All works of art will be for sale. Funds raised will go towards projects within the Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.
Please note Sunday 9 November hours 10am to 4pm

item.title: Carols By Candlelight in Horsham
item.description:
Carols By Candlelight in Horsham is an entertaining family evening out as you sing along a to Christmas Carols with the choir.
There will be food stalls available and entertainment for the children prior to the commencement of the carols.
Bring along a chair or picnic blanket and picnic basket enjoy the community spirit. Candles and programs available for a gold coin donation.

item.title: Makers Gallery Christmas Market
item.description:
The Maker's Gallery holds their annual Christmas Market, where you will find many local art and craft products and items to purchase, Great for those hard to buy for relatives and friends. It might even inspire you to get into that craft item you have been putting off.
Held once a year in front of the Horsham Library, this market as so much to offer and is not to be missed.

item.title: Natimuk Farmers Market Plus
item.description:
Natimuk is nestled at the base of Mt Arapiles and Mitre Rock; a peoples Market comprising of three distinct sections, the Natimuk Farmers Market Plus has something for everyone.
The Sunday market is a central place where people gather to support local and regional produce growers including organic producers, local artists and craft persons in a vibrant lively music atmosphere. Community groups provide sausage sizzle, sweet and savory crepes include gluten free and vegan, plus tea and coffee.

item.title: Haven Market
item.description:
All are welcome to the Haven Market, a monthly event held on the first Saturday of each month from 9am to 1pm (with the exception of January) Convened by the Haven Recreation Reserve committee, all funds raised are used to improve facilities for the benefit of the community, the local primary school and visitors.
Hundreds of people enjoy the relaxed atmosphere of the Market located in a picturesque bush setting only five minutes from the city centre of Horsham.
There is always a diverse range of stalls from delicious homemade sauces, relish, cakes and jams, locally grown honey, organic vegetables, bread and buns, through to locally made arts and crafts, baby produce, plants and many others.
Sit and enjoy a cappuccino or hot chocolate, or indulge in a hot jam donut while listening to the live music provided by Don Papst and his members of the Key Change band.
The Market is renowned for its Egg & Bacon Muffin Breakfast supplied by the local tennis club, followed by a barbecue supplied by the local primary school.
Please don't miss Haven's monthly market - it is a very popular event - not just for the produce it provides but also the welcoming community spirit of the bush.

item.title: The People's Weather Report
item.description:
The deadline for audio reports has just been extended to 5 November.
Now more than ever, climate change is one of the most pressing issues facing our planet. It is easy to feel overwhelmed by the sheer magnitude and concerned by the polarizing conversation. The People’s Weather Report is a global response to the enormity of climate change from a very personal perspective: yours!
Arts House are seeking participants to take part in this global project. The People’s Weather Report is seeking 300 audio 'weather reports' from around the world. These audio weather reports will be edited together to form part of a sculptural sound installation created by eco designer Tanja Beer, and showcased during sustainability festival, Going Nowhere. Arts House partner ABC RN will also produce two one-hour packages for radio broadcast.
Do you have concerns about the climate? What is happening weather-wise in your part of the world? If you’d like to make a contribution by sharing your individual thoughts on weather and the climate, then you can.
The weather reports don’t have to be recorded on fancy audio equipment, you can simply use a smart phone – they just need to be in digital format, and 3-5 minutes each. Visit the website for technical instructions and the email address to send your submission.
Weather report submissions must close 5 November. Presented by Arts House.
Source: City of Melbourne What's On

item.title: The Bloke Show
item.description:
The Bloke Show brings together seven artists who explore masculinity from different perspectives, whether critiquing white male colonisation of indigenous cultures, celebrating sporting heroes, or contemplating rural male isolation.
The exhibition forms the culmination of the 2014 RMIT Print Imaging Practice Residency. Artists have been commissioned to develop a print edition, which will be available for purchase from the galleries.

item.title: Azimuth
item.description:
Azimuth makes reference to the 'points of view' from which people view, experience and create in the world.
This exhibition is an exploration of the trajectories of practices borne out of ceramics, and gold and silver smithing traditions and brings together a group of contemporary object makers.
See website for more information.

item.title: Healthy Harvest Festival
item.description:
Sarah Court Preschool will host its first Healthy Harvest Festival. A community-wide event, the Healthy Harvest Festival aims to inspire all people to buy locally, grow their own edible food and learn ways to prepare fresh, healthy meals.
The Festival is a great day of family fun, with live music, live horticulture demonstrations, loads of children's activities and market and community stalls. The overarching goal is to bring residents together to celebrate their gardens and they hope to have a community-wide presence on the day.
Time: 9:00am - 1:00pm,
You can find out more on the website.

item.title: Tiki Comedy - Free Weekly Comedy!
item.description:
Venture into Richmond's deliciously naughty Tiki Lounge & Bar to get boozed on pirate rum, stroke the furry (leopard) wall and laugh your tatas off!
Every week features an amazing line-up of 10 or so hilarious comics who will have you in stitches from beginning to end!
Gold coin donations welcome - for the month of July, all proceeds will go to The Lost Dogs' Home.
Bar is cash only.

item.title: Treasures and Tastes @ Trinity
item.description:
Held on the third Saturday of every month, the Treasures and Tastes @ Trinity is a local makers and producers market in Surrey Hills, Melbourne.
Stall holders make everything they sell themselves and the market has a range of stalls from fresh produce such as honey, vegetables, jams, cakes to wine, home crafts, children's clothes and accessories, art work.
Come and have a scone and hot drink in the Treasures Cafe or treat yourself to a yummy egg and bacon roll from the courtyard barbecue.
The market has a hidden treasures room with new stall every month. If your looking for a morning out and about, the Treasures and Tastes Market is the place to be.
The market is predominantly a, indoor market and cater for all weather!

item.title: Meet the Rats
item.description: Meet the Rats of Tobruk, Ron Williamson and Bob Semple, as they share their recollections of the siege 73 years ago. Hear about their battle experiences, living conditions and the camaraderie which was shared by the Rats, as they were to be forevermore named. This mateship continues today in the Rats of Tobruk Association, supported by a broad network of friends honouring their efforts and contribution.

item.title: Friends Only: Opening of the Galleries of Remembrance
item.description:
This October, Friends of the Shrine are exclusively invited to preview the new Galleries of Remembrance before it opens to the public. Be among some of the first visitors to see remarkable exhibits, including the SS Devanha landing boat and Rolls of Honour displaying the names of all Victorians who enlisted in the Second World War, Korean War and Vietnam War. Full details, including the date of the event, will be announced on the Shrine website.
Support the Shrine and become a Friend. For further information contact David Howell, Fundraising and Friends Coordinator or visit the website.

image.altText: Friends Only: Opening of the Galleries of Remembrance
Friends Only: Opening of the Galleries of Remembrance

item.title: Forty Thousand Horsemen
item.description: In a cinematic tribute to the mounted troops of the Australian Light Horse regiments, director Charles Chauvel presents his 1940 feature-length film Forty Thousand Horsemen. Featuring iconic Australian actors Grant Taylor, Chips Rafferty and Pat Twohill, the story follows three best mates through challenging times as soldiers - from mischief in Cairo in 1916 through to the action of the Australian Light Horse in the charge of Beersheba. Join them for their first film screening in the Shrine's new auditorium.

item.title: Childrens Week Picnic
item.description:
Wyndham City will proudly present the Children's Week Picnic at Werribee Park on Sunday 26 October 2014 from 10am to 4pm.
This free event is a fun, family friendly day full of interactive activities for children. Sports, craft, music, dance and much more, ensure the little ones are engaged in healthy and active fun and play.
The Looney Tunes Show will entertain from the stage as well as children can meet their favourite character including Tweety, Daffy & Bugs Bunny!
Entry to the Picnic and all activities are free.

item.title: Bairnsdale Regional Lecture: The Other ANZACs
item.description:
Held at the Bairnsdale RSL, Peter Rees tells the story of the 'other' ANZACs who worked in the hospital camps, wards and tent surgeries on the edge of some of the most horrific battlefronts of human history.
Discussing their efforts and experiences from the outbreak of war, Peter provides insight to the dedication and strength of these Australian women. These were the women who left for war on an adventure and were soon confronted with remarkable challenges that their civilian lives could never have prepared them for.

item.title: Old Treasury Building Free Floor Talks
item.description:
Come along to the Old Treasury Free Floor Talk Series at 11am on the first Tuesday of every month.
Talks include:
- 1 July: Sandridge: the pier and the first rail link. - 5 August: Willamstown - 2 September: Troop ships - 7 October: Migrant ships - 18 November: Luxury liners.

item.title: Air Force Band – Firebird
item.description:
Air Force Band presents 'Firebird', the third and final concert dedicated to celebrating the centenary of military aviation in Australia.
On 1 March 1914, one hundred years ago, the first military flight in Australia took place at Point Cook, the oldest continually operating military airfield in the world. Opening with Ron Goodwin's '633 Squadron', the Air Force Band will continue to celebrate the centenary of this momentous event and the significant advances in air and space power over the past 100 years. Stravinsky's spectacular 'Firebird Suite' will conclude this year's Iwaki concert series, showcasing the precision, agility and excellence of the Air Force Band.

item.title: Daylesford and Hepburn Springs Summer Mineral Water Festival
item.description:
The Daylesford and Hepburn Springs area has 85% of Australia's Mineral Water, so twice a year the community comes up with innovative ways to bring it to you via food and drink.
The summer festival will feature natural organic mineral water beers, apple cider, ginger beer and Daiquiris in many different flavours, ices and very innovative cakes, beer cakes and more.
They are introducing iced tea and sorbets to the list of yummie show-off goodies.
The French Provincial cakes and biscuits were a popular feature at the Winter Festival so they will bring them back. The beer chocolate muffins will definitely be back!
The Mulle Wine (even though they received a great deal of complaints that they put too much red wine into it.... it's a stayer and more people liked it that way) was also a great hit, the hot Mayan Chocolate will be back; all made with the region's mineral water.
A great new band will be performing for young and old.
Come along with the whole family and enjoy the merriment and excellent healthy mineral water produce.

item.title: Paper Arts Exhibition @ Mont De Lancey
item.description:
The Paper Arts exhibition is the collection of art forms employing paper as the primary artistic medium. It lends itself to a wide range of techniques, as it can for instance be printed on, folded, cut, glued, moulded, stitched, or layered. Papermaking by hand is also an important paper craft.
The exhibition opening is at 2pm on Saturday 1st November 2014 and runs until Sunday 23rd November 2014. Opening hours are 10:00am to 4:30pm.

image.altText: Paper Arts Exhibition @ Mont De Lancey
Paper Arts Exhibition @ Mont De Lancey

item.title: Valkstone Primary School Fair
item.description:
Enjoy a great day out with family and friends at the Valkstone Primary School Fair.
Come and have a great day of fun at the Fair, with cakes, auction, lollies, games, rides, show bags, crafts, plants, raffles, novelties, toys, fairy floss, photo booth and much more.
Valkstone's Fair is held on Sunday, 9 November 2014, from 10 am to 3 pm.

item.title: Shirt and Skirt Markets
item.description:
Held in the grounds of the beautiful Abbotsford Convent, the Shirt and Skirt Markets are open on the third Sunday of each month throughout the year.
The Shirt and Skirt Markets is the perfect place for emerging fashion designers to showcase their talents and sell their beautiful creations to the general public. Mens, women's and children's fashion, as well as jewellery, homewares and skincare are just some of the things you'll find.
On the third Sunday of each month you will find four eateries, two markets, two art galleries, the Collingwood Children's Farm next door plus spacious heritage gardens, it's easy to spend a whole day at the Convent.

item.title: Kannamaroo Festival
item.description:
Kannamaroo Festival is an annual event with great family entertainment for all to enjoy and family fun activities.
The street carnival follows down Firebrace Street on Friday evening. The festival offers food, crafts, kids carnival rides, music and lots of live entertainment. Bring the family for late night shopping and enjoy the atmosphere. The festivities continue on the Saturday afternoon with skiing demonstrations on the Wimmera River.

item.title: Docklands – From Wetlands to Working Dock to Modern City
item.description:
Discover when Docklands was a vast wetlands and a popular hunting ground of the Kulin nation before being transformed to a major industrialised area in the late 1800s. Developments saw the course of the Yarra River changed dramatically and the creation of Victoria Dock. These new wharves became Victoria's busiest and one of the largest single docks in the world.
With containerisation changing the face of shipping in the 1950s and 1960s, more suitable ports were built further downstream in the 1950s and 1960s leaving this once bustling area as a disused wasteland that attracted much government attention as a critical area for regeneration. Modern Docklands is the creation of one of Australia's largest urban renewal projects and will significantly expand Melbourne's CBD upon completion. Docklands now houses several modern landmarks and has become a vibrant hub for workers, residents and visitors alike.

item.title: Point Lonsdale Market
item.description:
The Point Lonsdale Market is one of the larger and more popular markets on the Bellarine Peninsula.
The market features local produce from locally made jams to spuds straight from the farmer's cart. Lovers of art and craft are not forgotten either with plenty home made clothes and artworks up for great prices. All goods are home made, produced or grown. There are art and craft stalls and plant and food stalls.
This market is held on the second Sunday of the month, on Easter Saturday and the first Saturday in December.
There are approximately 150 stalls, indoor and outdoor, with goodies for the whole family.

item.title: Lake Wendouree Smart Living Market
item.description:
The Lake Wendouree Smart Living Market is a lively farmers market featuring boutique regional produce. This market is popular among the locals and visitors of Ballarat.
It is set in the scenic surrounds of Lake Wendouree. Shoppers can peruse and sample their way through the myriad of stallholders while enjoying the fine produce and music.
This is a dog friendly market and please make sure you bring your own bag or trolley.

item.title: ANL Maritime Art Exhibition
item.description:
Mission To Seafarers Victoria invites the public to attend Australia's leading maritime exhibition. Themed, 'The Relationship Between Humanity And The Sea', the exhibition, judged by an esteemed art prize committee, celebrates the sea and all things nautical. The exhibition of over 80 paintings will run at the Norla Dome Gallery, 717 Flinders Street, Docklands, from 3rd October to 31st October 2014.
Art aficionados and those who are drawn to the sea, admire the form of ships or simply dream of sailing will enjoy the exhibition, which showcases these subjects in all their majesty. The artwork will adorn the walls of The Norla Dome Gallery, itself a reason to attend the exhibition. An architectural wonder of some 95 years old, it was originally built as a gymnasium for seafarers. Currently used for weddings, exhibitions and other functions, the Dome Gallery will certainly enhance the ambience of the exhibition. Visitors cannot ask for a more unique setting.
Visitors are welcome to purchase the works, all of which will be for sale. A percentage of the sale price will goes toward the work of the Mission - supporting the well-being of seafarers. Globally, 1.4 million merchant sailors traverse the seas, transporting 95 per cent of world trade.
Enjoy!

item.title: Story Lounge
item.description:
Do you like to listen to a good story? Library at The Dock is introducing a storytime for adults.
Bring your lunch, relax, knit, dream or enjoy the view, as you are read a hand-picked story or two.
Story Lounge happens at noon, on the fourth Wednesday of the month, in the beautiful new Library at The Dock.

item.title: Sailing into Melbourne
item.description:
This winter, the Old Treasury Building will feature an impressive display of nautical history highlighting the extraordinary past of Melbourne's famous port.
Sailing into Melbourne will showcase major records from the collection of Public Record Office Victoria, covering grim stories of quarantine, devastating shipwrecks and grand voyages from Australia to Europe carrying large amounts of gold.
Entry is Free!

item.title: Bairnsdale Makers' Market
item.description:
Enjoy an extensive range of handmade clothing, craft, woodwork and other locally designed and created products. There's something for everyone, particularly the kids.
Indulge your creative side and support small business. The market is held indoors and runs rain, hail or shine.
Situated adjacent to the Bairnsdale Farmers' Market at the Bairnsdale Secondary College

item.title: Bairnsdale Farmers' Market
item.description:
Discover the finest produce in Gippsland at the Bairnsdale Farmers' Market on the first Saturday of the month.
You will discover the finest cheeses, dips, pesto's and marinates. This is your opportunity to obtain fresh vegetables, potatoes and pumpkin.
Enjoy a variety of fresh apples and rhubarb or pure honey or fudge or ice cream and berries.
The market is a great way to purchase your lamb or fresh lamb sausages, smoked meats and venison.
Take home some Dargo walnuts, goats milk and cheeses, pasta, jams and sauces, chutneys and eggs.
Check out the large variety of cakes, biscuits and organic breads, olive oil and vegetable soaps.
Purchase Australian native plants, flowers or check the range of potted colour and many other plants.
Finish your visit with the best of the local wines or a coffee or a freshly cooked breakfast.

item.title: Dawn to Dusk
Basil Sellers Art Prize 4
item.description:
Sport and art come together again with 16 finalists competing in the fourth biennial Basil Sellers Art Prize. With $100,000 awarded to the winner, this is one of Australia's richest and most prestigious art prizes.
The Basil Sellers Art Prize encourages artists to take on the theme of sport in any artistic medium and supports artists whose work explores Australia's obsession with sport.
The works of the finalists will be exhibited at the Ian Potter Museum of Art from 22 July to 26 October.

ns0:venue.name: Ian Potter Museum of Art, University of Melbourne

item.title: Take 2 Markets - Queen Victoria Market Pop Up
item.description:
Take 2 Markets are back at The Queen Victoria Market C Shed.
Take 2 is Melbourne's longest running recycled fashion market is the place to buy and sell fabulous fashion. Find Lady Danger, Mazii, Pearl's Vintage Closet, Lady Divine Vintage Hats and many more wonderful stallholders. Expect to find Australian and international designers, High Street brands plus some cool vintage and retro gear.
Did they mention accessories? Shoes, hats, sunnies, jewellery - you name it!
Join the thousands of women who regularly shop with them and find yourself something wonderful. All the fashion and accessories will be priced to sell - up to 80% off the recommended retail price! You will be an environmental fashionista without even trying.

item.title: Gembrook Market
item.description:
Come down to the Gembrook Market and see a wide range of mostly locally grown and made craft and produce for sale.
Find everything from Crafts, Jewellery, plants to soaps and other handmade goods and foods. Tantalise your taste buds with freshly brewed coffee, a range of sweet and savoury foods, a community barbecue operated by Gembrook Community groups available.
Stallholder and volunteer enquiries welcome.

item.title: Yarragon Market
item.description:
The monthly Yarragon Market has a range of art, craft and produce from the West Gippsland region.
Nestled in the foothills of the Strzelecki ranges with vistas of green rolling hills Yarragon Village is a charming country town with an abundance of delightful shops and places to eat to satisfy all desires.

item.title: Longwarry Fire Brigade Market
item.description:
The Longwarry Fire Brigade Market is a popular monthly market offering something for everyone: craft, produce, trash & treasure and much more.
