Longwarry is located at the entrance to Baw Baw Shire and a good starting point to explore the region. Once you have stocked up at the market, why not visit one of the wineries in Labertouche, Warragul or Brandy Creek or head to one of the many walking trails in Baw Baw?
Held on the first Sunday of each month, with the exception January and February.

item.title: Drouin Craft & Produce Market
item.description:
The Rotary Club of Drouin presents this monthly Drouin Craft & Produce Market offering fresh produce, clothing, jewellery, plants, preserves and much more.
Held in beautiful Civic Park Drouin, the market has been on Baw Baw's market calendar for a number of years. Wander over to the Drouin CBD, which is only a one minute walk from the market and browse the variety of shops.

item.title: Yoga at Fed Square
item.description:
Improve your physical, mental and spiritual well-being with free lunchtime yoga classes at Fed Square.
Take a break from the busy city life and incorporate meditation and tranquillity into your day. Stretching and postures focus on controlled breathing to improve core strength and flexibility.
All skill levels welcome from beginners to advanced.

item.title: Warragul Farmers Market
item.description:
Warragul Farmers Market is a place for people to meet and support local farmers and producers and buy a huge range of fresh and hand made food.
More than 50 stallholders will be selling their locally-grown, locally-made products; from bread, to cheese, to olive oil to fresh fruit and vegetables and much more. Experience quality Gippsland grown and made food at beautiful Civic Park.
Warragul Farmers Market is held the third Saturday of each month, all year round.
Parking at the Arts Centre or Mason Street car parks.

item.title: Improve Your Public Speaking and Gain Confidence
item.description:
If you are interested in practising your presentation skills, clearly articulating ideas and improving your self-confidence, this workshop is for you.
Pushing the Envelope Toastmasters will help you nurture these skills by providing a supportive and friendly environment for you to develop and build your communication and leadership skills at your own pace. It is a diverse group with varied speaking skill levels and backgrounds. Meetings generally focus on three aspects of public speaking: prepared speeches, impromptu speaking, and giving speech evaluations.

item.title: Victor Hugo: Les Misérables - From Page to Stage
item.description:
Take a journey from the 19th-century Paris of Victor Hugo's novel, Les Misérables to today's blockbuster stage musical at the Sate Library of Victoria.
Featuring rare items from the collections of the Bibliothèque nationale de France, Maison de Victor Hugo, Musée Rodin, Cameron Mackintosh Archive and others, this exhibition is a world-first insight into the most popular French story of all time.
Exclusive to the State Library of Victoria, the exhibition takes you on a themed, multi-sensory exploration of:
- Original drawings and watercolours by Victor Hugo - Rare scripts, scores, designs and posters from the 1985 Royal Shakespeare Company production - Original costumes and designs from the cinematic portrayals of Les Misérables - including the 2012 film starring Anne Hathaway and Hugh Jackman - An entire gallery, including interactive displays, dedicated to the current Melbourne stage musical, giving visitors the chance to dress up and take centre stage.
Opening in July 2014, to coincide with the arrival of Cameron Mackintosh's acclaimed new production of Les Misérables in Melbourne, this collection of iconic rarities is not to be missed.

item.title: Vincent St Makers Market
item.description:
The Vincent Street Makers Market is located inside Daylesford Town Hall in the main street of the beautiful township of Daylesford.
The market showcases high quality unique and boutique handmade products by talented local and regional designers and artists.
Offering a wide variety of handmade stalls, they always love to hear from new designers, artists and makers.

item.title: Projector Bike Free Friday Night Rides
item.description:
Projector Bike brings is a unique mobile cinema to you and will be showing award-winning short films in their free Friday night rides.
Projector Bike is a custom-designed three wheeled cargo bike complete with a high-powered projector and stereo system. Projector Bike operates in public places and shows content to large audiences.
This mobile ensemble enables images and films to be shown in public places to large audiences. The projections can be the size of buildings or as small as a television set.
Projector Bike take stories to new audiences - a small group at a tram stop or a mass gathering in the city centre. They can ride up to any audience or crowd and show engaging content and award winning films.
The rides are mobile, agile, quick to get around; the first to find a new audience.
This is a free event for all-ages.

item.title: Valkstone Primary School Fair
item.description: Valkstone Primary is holding their school fete on Sunday 9th November 2014. Starting at 10am come along for a great day of fun for all the family. There will be rides, games, great food and coffee. Held on the school grounds of Valkstone Primary in Valkstone Street, Bentleigh East. Come and celebrate an enjoyable day out with our community.

item.title: Family Fun Day at Holy Rosary School
item.description:
The Holy Rosary Family Fun Day on Saturday 15 November 2014 is promising to be bigger and better than ever.
Entry is free and there will be lots of entertainment for all the family, including face painting, children's amusement rides, pony rides, a live and silent auction, cakes, breads and preserves, plants and flowers, Asian Food, hot chips and BBQ, fairy floss and snow cones, second-hand clothing, books and toys, demonstrations from community organisations, Devonshire tea and great coffee, craft and kids craft activities, lollies, show bags and lucky dips, a chocolate toss and much more.
With plenty of family-friendly things to see and do, grab your children and come on down to the Holy Rosary Family Fun Day!

item.title: Family Fun Day - Holy Rosary School
item.description:
Plans for the Holy Rosary Family Fun Day on Saturday 15 November 2014 are well underway, promising to be bigger and better than ever. The Fun Day is being held at the Holy Rosary School Grounds at 37 Gower Street in Kensington and will run from 10am to 3pm. Entry is free and there will be lots of free entertainment for all the family. Activities and stalls are still being confirmed but in previous years the community has enjoyed:
• Face painting • Children’s Rides • Auction • Cakes, breads and preserves • Plants and flowers • Asian Food and BBQ • Fairy Floss • Snow Cones • Books • 2nd hand clothing and toys • Demonstrations from community organisations • Money tree • Craft • Major raffle • And much more!
With plenty of family-friendly things to see and do, grab your children and get ready for the Holy Rosary Family Fun Day.
Come along rain, hail or shine!

item.title: Indonesia Street Festival
item.description:
The Annual Indonesia Street Festival brings together the Indonesian Community living and supporting in the state of Victoria. This annual event ensures community collaborations and opportunities for the Indonesian businesses to showcase the best of culture, taste, sights and sounds of Indonesia.
This events also celebrate a significant day in Indonesian tradition called Kartini Day. This event symbolises Mothers day and a day celebrating women's role within Indonesian society.
There will be 20 restaurants featuring traditional and authentic Indonesian cuisine added with the twist of high quality food from the South East Asian neighbours. They will definitely ensure your taste buds are fulfilled. Immerse yourself in the wonderful traditional dancers from the Indonesian archipelago from Sumatra, to the Eastern sea of Indonesia.
Come dressed in your traditional Indonesian outfits and enjoy this wonderful celebration.
item.ns0:organiser: Alive Group Indonesia Muslim Community Victoria

item.title: Open Garden Weekend
item.description:
The private homestead garden at Warratina Lavender Farm will be open again this year to the public on the 29 and 30 November.
There will be garden walks around the homestead and along the driveway displaying a range of salvias, roses, rhododendrons, azaleas and more.
The first lavenders will be in full bloom giving you a magnificent display of purple in the fields.
Lavender harvesting will be demonstrated using traditional methods as well as demonstrations of old-time crafts, wood turning, spinning and lace-making.
Market stalls, food vendors, music, Devonshire teas, luncheons and children's entertainment are all part of the weekend.
Proceeds from the day will be donated to the local CFA.

item.title: Tarwin Lower Local Seasonal Market
item.description:
Held at Tarwin Lower Primary School; come down to the Tarwin Lower Seasonal Market, bring the whole family and make a fun day of it.
Stalls include, local produce, arts and crafts, poultry and pets, food, plants entertainment and much more.
For more information on the market, please see the Facebook page.

item.title: Wentworth Country Music Rotary Main Street Market
item.description:
Join the fun and support the community with the Rotary Club of Wentworth. Supporting the Wentworth rotary market, supports the work the Rotary club does in the community.
The market brings people and their community together for the festivities, fun and entertainment of a traditional village market.
Enjoy the variety of stalls and display, it's fun for the whole family.

item.title: Dandenong Ranges Open Studios Weekend
item.description:
The Dandenong Ranges Open Studios will take place on April 18 and 19 and is an opportunity for art lovers to take a behind-the-scenes look into the life and work of the region's finest designers, painters, makers and sculptors.
An invitation to observe an artist's life. For a single weekend this autumn, you are invited to experience the world that unfolds within the working studios of artists in the charming Dandenong Ranges.

address.address1: Cnr Glenfern Road and Matson Drive

item.title: Poetry at Fed Square
item.description:
Each month different poets present their new works in a public setting to an ever-changing audience. It is an opportunity to hear new words and voices.
Readers and presenters come from all walks of literary life: some are published authors; some are translators; some are first time authors with a piece of work in progress to test; while others will read/present a bilingual writing of another author. Over the years, more than 1000 different poets, translators and open readers have participated in the program.
The regular format allows for feature presenters, reading up to 20 minutes each.
There is also an open mic section for those wanting to share their lovely words for just five minutes each. Please do not hesitate to come forward to ask to read.
Held on the third Saturday of each month.

item.title: Creswick Market
item.description:
The Creswick Market is held the third Saturday of every month. Bring the kids and your four-footed friends, all are welcome.
Located in the picturesque and historic township of Creswick, just 20 minutes to either Ballarat or Daylesford the Creswick Market a great day out for the whole family.
Free live music and over 90 specialist boutique sites, offering a variety of unique handmade goods ranging from arts and crafts to freshly made delicacies, something for everyone. Talk directly to producers and designers, learn about the ingredients and processes that brought the item to you.
The market features: gourmet take away food and great coffee; live music; kids entertainment and playground; beautiful gardens to relax in; historic township to explore; hand made arts, crafts, jewellery, clothes, home grown fruit, vegetables, plants and other produce.
Creswick Market is a much-loved monthly event, with the true relaxed feel of a regional craft market. A must see for all residents and visitors of the Goldfield region.

item.title: Feel Young
item.description:
Drawing from ancient Chinese traditions, Feel Young combines gentle exercise and dance in a program suitable for all ages.
Led by expert instructors from the Federation of Chinese Associations, Feel Young is designed to invigorate the mind and the body, building fitness, balance and mobility.
Classes are held on the second and fourth Thursday of every month, 10.30am - 12.30pm.
All ages are welcome and bookings not required.

item.title: Belly Dancing at Fed Square
item.description:
Shimmy and shake with free 30 minute Belly Dancing at Fed Square classes.
Led by professional instructor Trisnasari, the gentle aerobic dance is perfect for toning and strengthening core muscles.
Classes are held on the second and fourth Thursday of each month, from 12.30pm until 1pm. No bookings required.
All ages and skill levels welcome.

item.title: Laughter Club
item.description:
Join in this free laughter session at Federation Square and experience the benefits of a good old chuckle.
Laughter has been shown to improve the physical, mental, emotional, spiritual and social health of individuals, workplaces and society. Get together for a medicinal belly laugh at Fed Square!
First and third Sunday of every month.

item.title: Crochet at Fed Square
item.description:
Crochet workshops are led by a small group of volunteer crochet enthusiasts who are working towards making poppies for the '5000 Poppies project'.
This arts and craft project gives crafters of all persuasions an opportunity to contribute to a large community tribute of respect and remembrance to Australian servicemen and women who have fought in all wars, conflicts and peacekeeping operations.
The goal of the 5000 poppies project is to create a field of 5000 poppies for display on ANZAC Day 2015, as part of Australia's 100th Anniversary commemoration of the Gallipoli landing.
Workshops are held on the second Monday of every month.
Please note that the workshop in April 2014 will be on Friday 25 April in commemoration of ANZAC Day.

item.title: Boroondara Farmers Market
item.description:
Visit the Boroondara Farmers Market every month to buy delicious, fresh produce. Held at Patterson Reserve on the third and fifth Saturday of the month, the market is a great day out for the whole family.
If you are passionate about food and the planet, join a dedicated group of farmers and locals who are as passionate as you are.
The Boroondara Farmers Market sells produce from all around Victoria. You can buy fresh fruit and vegetables, seasonal organic produce, meat, herbs, honey, eggs, bread, olives, cakes, dips and sauces, even wine and beer.
Talk directly to producers and learn about the ingredients and processes that brought the food to you. It's all part of shopping in a community, reducing food miles and supporting small Victorian primary producers. Bring the kids and your four-footed friends - you're all welcome.
The market is accredited with the Victorian Farmers Market Association and proudly supports the principles behind genuine farmers markets. For more information, visit the website.
The Boroondara Farmers' Market is an initiative of the City of Boroondara in partnership with the Rotary Club of Glenferrie. All money raised assists with community projects run by Rotary of Glenferrie and Foundation Boroondara.

item.title: Mildura Revisited: Sculptures Exhibited 1961-1978
item.description:
Curated by Ken Scarlett, Mildura Revisited: Sculptures Exhibited 1961-1978 will focus attention on the Mildura Sculpture Triennials and the influence of gallery directors Ernst Van Hattum and Tom McCullough.
The exhibition will consist of works in the Mildura Arts Centre collection, supplemented with works on loan from State and Regional Galleries and private collections.
Photographs of ephemera earth works, installations and performances will be displayed on the walls of the gallery.

item.title: Coopers Australian Music Prize
item.description:
Five of the shortlisted artists of this year's Coopers Australian Music Prize will perform live showcase sets as part of the Australia Day Concert at the Bowl.
The Coopers AMP is about discovering, promoting and rewarding excellence in Australian music.
Stay tuned for 2015's program to be announced for another brilliant day out!

item.title: Easter Powersports Show and Sine
item.description: The Easter Powersports weekend is a significant event on the Mildura events calendar. Easter Powersports comprises of four sporting clubs who run major sporting competitions over the Easter weekend. These clubs include: Mildura Ski Club, Sunraysia Drag Racing Association, Timmis Speedway and Mildura Motorcycle Club. The Show and Shine which is held on Good Friday each year, provides a showcase of all the various powersports vehicles in a vibrant, exciting high octane atmosphere.

item.title: Emerald Market
item.description:
Emerald Market is held on the third Sunday of each month and has become a meeting place for locals and tourist alike.
The stallholders have a varied offering; organic and local produce, speciality food items, handmade and vintage clothing and gift ware, plants and ornaments, and gourmet hot food.
The market is open from 9am in Kilvington Drive, Emerald and is a short stroll from the Emerald Puffing Billy station.
The market has a vibrant atmosphere with buskers and performers.

item.title: Hamilton Farmers and Craft Market
item.description:
The Hamilton Farmers' and Craft Market showcases local produce and local designers.
Enjoy a sausage sizzle, while your browse the stalls, with stalls showcasing local wine, local produce, crafts, arts and food.
The Hamilton Farmers and Craft Market is a monthly market usually held on the last Saturday of month.

item.title: SunFest - Sunbury Community Festival
item.description:
SunFest's, now approaching its 39th year is held on the third weekend of March each year on the Village Green in Sunbury,
The free to enter two day festival is full of fun and entertainment for all ages.
SunFest is well supported by local traders, businesses, residents, the community and visitors from all around Melbourne and Country Victoria.
With thousands of people attending SunFest each year, we will again offer great attractions on our main stage and dance floor with local talent, and national acts, Battle of the School Choirs, SunFest Talent Shows, award winning entertainers and children's entertainment.
For the last 39 years we have been running our ever popular Grand Street Parade. Again this year we have Sunbury Idol and are introducing Sunbury Can Dance and our ever popular Reardon Amusement Rides and Carnival Games, Roving Entertainers, Walk and Run for FUN, a Health and Safety Expo and much, much more.

item.title: Gerang Gerung Market
item.description:
Gerang Gerung Market is a grassroots country market located just off the Western Highway in between Dimboola and Nhill.
The Gerang Gerung Market specialises in a large variety of handmade crafts and produce.
The market is a great family fun day out for all with entertainment, live music, Devonshire Teas, BBQ, joy flights as well as activities for the kids!
Bus parking is available.

item.title: 2014 Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship
item.description:
The sixth edition of the Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship will be held from October 23-26, 2014, at the prestigious Royal Melbourne Golf Club in Melbourne, located in Victoria, Australia.
The Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship is the leading amateur golf event in the region. Previous winners include Hideki Matsuyama, now ranked within the world's top 50, and Guan Tianlang, the 14 year old Chinese schoolboy who took the golfing world by storm when he made the cut at the Masters Tournament last year.
The Royal Melbourne Golf Club has two courses, the East Course and the West Course, which are ranked amongst the best in the world. The 2013 Australian Masters and 2013 World Cup were both staged at this beautiful golf club, where some of the world's top-10 golfers, such as Adam Scott, Matt Kuchar and Jason Day, played on this magnificently golf course.
The winner of the Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship will receive an invitation to play in the 2015 Masters Tournament, and, together with the runner(s)-up, will earn a place in International Final Qualifying for the 2015 Open Championship.

image.altText: Korea's Lee Chang-woo celebrates with the Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship (AAC) trophy
Champion Lee Chang-woo earned a berth at the 2014 Masters Tournament as well as a spot in International Final Qualifying for next year's Open Championship

item.title: Myrtleford Cotters Market
item.description:
The Cotters Market is an intimate market, presented by The Myrtleford Festival Committee focusing on locally grown and produced foods, crafts and items.
Stallholders are from North East Victoria and surrounding areas and all items for sale are grown or made by the stallholder.
The Cotters Market stallholder registration form is available from the Myrtleford Festival Visitor Information Centre and the Myrtleford Neighbourhood Centre, or alternatively it can be downloaded from the website.
Book a stall or come along and find some great items to buy!

item.title: Time Lapse
item.description: Christopher Handran is a Brisbane-based artist whose practice explores the mediation of experience by technologies and seeks to foreground the perceptual dimensions of spectatorship. Time Lapse brings together two such technologies, the camera obscura and the clock. Most often cited as a precursor to the photographic camera, the camera obscura is also an apparatus that historically informed the understanding of perception and acted as a model for conceiving of the perceiving subject. This exhibition places the spectator inside this historical apparatus, creating a space in which to watch time passing?

item.title: The Sculptor’s Photograph
item.description:
The Sculptor's Photograph interrogates the relationship between sculpture and photography. Mimicking Brancusi's practice of photographing his own sculptures, Emma Hamilton's black and white photographs her sculptural work harness light and shadow to create a dramatic alternative set of 'documentation'.
The images become works in their own right, revealing moments that we cannot see within the physical work.

item.title: Maiden, Mother, Crone
item.description:
Maiden, Mother, Crone expands Aldhan's research in contemporary feminist studies and alternative spiritualities, responding to the modern-female experience via the neo-pagan triple-goddess allegory.
New video and sculptural work depict the body in states of transgression and receptivity, subjugated by a wide range of social and cultural mechanisms, threading together ideas about ritual, gender, identity and the grotesque.

item.title: Blueherring Pop-up
item.description:
The Blueherring pop-up is a mini-exhibition and retail stand for photographic artwork about Melbourne.
Unique memories and moments of Melbourne are available on quality cards, calendars, fridge magnets, limited edition prints, canvases, and other one-off artworks. All work is created by local Melbourne artist and photographer, Analise.
Artwork focuses on architecture, Melbourne's famous laneways and other iconic scenes.

item.title: Moyneyana Festival
item.description:
The Moyneyana Festival is in its 67th year and is known for its enduring tribute to community spirit. The festival runs over five weeks from Christmas Eve through to Australia Day each year.
The Festival has developed over the years to become a favourite summer celebration in the south-west of Victoria. Initiated in 1947, the festival helps to raise funds for the local hospital, and attracts crowds of 15,000 visitors each year.
The 3YB Coast FM Moyneyana Festival is considered one of the longest running community festivals in Australia. Its longevity attests to the community support it enjoys.
Almost all featured events are free and held in the main street, the village green or other public spaces. The only pre-requisite for the festival is to bring a picnic blanket or folding chairs. Come join them for Moyneyana Festival's Australia Day celebrations and all the other fun activities they have planned until then.
Moyneyana Festival is free, fun, simple and everyone is welcome. Please contact or view website for further information.

item.title: Fitness at Fed Square
item.description:
Get active with free Fitness at Fed Square, led by health coaches and fitness instructors from Healthy Lifestyle Lounge.
These classes, aimed to help city workers keep fit and healthy, include circuit-based exercise which incorporates body weight exercises, cardio training and core strength movements.
Classes are simple, fun and great for invigorating the mind, body and soul. All ages and fitness levels welcome.
In the case of wet weather, classes will be held in the Atrium.

item.title: Northern Regards Artisan Market
item.description:
The Northern Regards Artisan Market is a partnership with Thornbury Women's Neighbourhood House and Northcote Social Club to bring a quality, highly curated market featuring sustainable handmade wares to one of Melbourne's thriving high streets.
Now, we know what you are thinking; not another market in Melbourne? And yes, it is another market in Melbourne. However the organisers believe that Northern Regards Artisan Market fills a gap in the current Melbourne market scene. Northern Regards Artisan Market is focused on attracting artisans that have a strong sustainable, up-cycled and recycled feel to their work.
Located in the band room of the iconic Northcote Social Club, we are Melbourne's only handmade market dedicated to all things handmade and sustainable. Our clever artisans and makers use sustainable techniques and materials. They also found the beauty in what others discard.

item.title: Wodonga Children's Fair 2014
item.description:
Held during National Children's Week, the action-packed 'Games of yesteryear' program will be interactive and entertaining, featuring, live performances on three stages, hands on interaction with farm animals, emergency services education displays, come and try sporting activities, construction vehicle display, early years community services and organisations and interactive arts hall.
In the lead-up to the event, there will be various free and discounted activities that will take place around Wodonga to celebrate Children's Week (October 18 to October 26).

image.altText: Children applying their skills to build a house

item.title: The changing face of Victoria
item.description:
The changing face of Victoria exhibition brings together historical artefacts, photographs, drawings, maps, letters and diaries to tell the stories of the people, places and events that have shaped life in Victoria over the past 200 years.
Located in the Dome Galleries overlooking the magnificent La Trobe Reading Room, the first section of the exhibition focuses on the early years of European settlement, daily life in rural Victoria, and the events and mythology surrounding that most famous Victorian, Ned Kelly.
Items on regular display include key artefacts such as the Batman Deeds, the last notes of Burke and Wills and Ned Kelly's armour.
In addition to these iconic pieces, The changing face of Victoria also features less well-known objects which will change over time. These include photographs, diaries and letters that bring individual people and aspects of everyday Melbourne and Victoria during the 20th and 21st centuries to life.
The exhibition contains a newly donated 133-year-old letter detailing the capture of Ned Kelly at the siege of Glenrowan. The letter is currently on public display with an iPad which allows users to view more than 60 pages of content and images of Ned Kelly including his armour, photos, letters and more through a new Ned Kelly app.

image.altText: Winslow’s Roller Skates and packaging, belonging to Ruby Beyer at the age of 22 months, 1889, Realia

item.title: Sunday Afternoon in the Gardens 2014 / 2015
item.description:
Sunday Afternoon in the Gardens
Bring a chair and enjoy a pleasant Sunday afternoon at the Hamilton Botanic Gardens. Make a day of it and bring the whole family along.
Held throughout the summer months, enjoy listening to some local performances.
Time: 2.00pm - 4.00pm
Performances will be held in the Gardens Rotunda.
(Cancelled if inclement weather)

item.title: Mansfield Farmers' Market
item.description:
Accredited by the Victorian Farmers Market Association, the Mansfield Farmers' Market is a fresh and artisan produce market held year-round in the median strip opposite the Post Office - right in the centre of Mansfield, on the fourth Saturday of the month.
Over 30 colourful marquees set up on the grassy median strip right in the middle of town, showcasing the best fresh and artisan produce from the region, such as cheese, sour dough bread, olive oil, free-range meats and eggs and fresh fruit and vegetables.
With visitors able to interact with the people who have grown or made the food, the market promotes a greater awareness of food provenance and food miles.
The Mansfield Farmers' Market is a great way to buy fresh food as well as catch up with friends.

image.altText: Mansfield farmers market under the trees
Mansfield farmers market under the trees
Open for business at the Mansfield Farmers Market
Open for business at the Mansfield Farmers Market
Fresh fruit and vegetables at the mansfield farmers market
Fresh fruit and vegetables at the mansfield farmers market
Fresh fruit and produce at the mansfield farmers market
Fresh fruit and produce at the mansfield farmers market

item.title: Pfeiffer Wines Autumn Farmers Market
item.description:
As the first leaves change colour and the nights turn cooler, it is clear that Autumn is coming. What better way to celebrate this new season than to stock up the pantry with a delicious assortment of autumnal produce?
With seasonal staples, gourmet indulgences, Autumn fruits and vegetables, hot food and great coffee available, it is the perfect excuse to join us and celebrate all things Autumn within our picturesque winery grounds, surrounded by the beautiful colours of Autumn.
There will be hot food and fresh coffee all day and of course all of our award winning Pfeiffer wines will be available for tasting and sales.

item.title: Pfeiffer Wines Summer Farmers Market 2014
item.description:
Summer heralds a bounty of seasonal produce, from fresh strawberries and vibrant, colourful vegetables to juicy apricots and deliciously fragrant peaches. To celebrate the return of Summer Pfeiffer Wines invites you to our Summer Farmers Market.
Pfeiffer Wines will have hot food, live music and good coffee, and of course and array of the freshest Summer produce available, from plump tomatoes to new season nectarines, specialty cheese to home made pasta, verjuice to artisan breads.
There will be hot food and fresh coffee all day and of course all of our award winning Pfeiffer wines will be available for tasting and sales.

item.title: RACV Australia Day Picnic and Vehicle Display
item.description:
Celebrate Australia Day in the Kings Domain where there will be a host of activities, food stalls and entertainment, including working dog displays, soccer, tai chi and mini-golf. There will also be more than 450 veteran, vintage and classic vehicles on show at the annual RACV Federation Vehicle display.
There will be a 21-gun salute at the Shrine of Remembrance at midday and the Royal Australian Air Force's elite aerobatic team will entertain crowds with their aerial flyover and display (subject to weather conditions). At 2pm there will be birthday celebrations for the 1000 Victorians who where born on Australia Day, so you can sing along with James Morrison and his band, plus there'll be free concerts in the Sidney Myer Music Bowl.
Supported by RACV in conjunction with the Federation of Veteran, Vintage and Classic Vehicle Clubs.

item.title: Australia Day Flag Raising Ceremony
item.description:
Come to the official flag raising ceremony as part of the Australia Day celebrations. His Excellency, the Honourable Alex Chernov, AC QC, Governor of Victoria officiates as the National Flag is raised at 10:30am.
The Governor will inspect the Tri-Service Royal Guard of Honour and the Premier of Victoria will lead the public in the Australia Day Affirmation.
Supported by the City of Melbourne.

item.title: Mildura City Market
item.description:
Find a gift among the many stalls that have lovely items for sale at the Mildura City Market.
There are crafts, socks, clothing, home cooking, fruit and vegetables as well as jams, honey, pickles and dried fruit. You will also find jewellery, natural beauty products, books, plants, fancy cards, woodwork items, bric-a-brac and locally made boomerangs and didgeridoos.
The market is managed by the Loddon Mallee Region Girl Guides.

item.title: 2014 New Year's Eve Celebration - Rotary Club of Hamilton North
item.description:
The New Year's Eve Street Party is organised by the Rotary Club of Hamilton North for the benefit for young families wishing to celebrate New Years Eve in Hamilton.
Free Entertainment includes jumping castle, slide, train rides, magician and much more...
Alcohol Free Zone. Fireworks will be held in Melville Oval, Lonsdale St.
Lion Club BBQ will be available for hot food and cold drinks.
Time: from 6.00pm Fireworks at 10:30

item.title: Beaufort Market
item.description:
Held in Memorial Park, the Beaufort Market offers a range of goods for sale from produce and plants to second-hand goods and jewellery.
The market also includes a sausage sizzle raising money for local charities. Stay for lunch and see what this great little town has to offer! The market is held on the first Saturday of every month.
item.ns0:organiser: Beaufort Community House and Learning Centre

item.title: Avoca Riverside Market
item.description:
The tranquillity of the venue on the grassy banks of the Avoca River adds to the enjoyment of meandering around the Riverside Market.
Browse more than 40 stalls providing a variety of goods including wine, crafts, fresh food, plants, garden care and clothing.
Held from 9am to 1pm on the fourth Sunday of every month, the November market will also host the very first run of the Pyrenees Historic Vehicle Club, with a most popular car vote being held.

item.title: Classics at Fed Square
item.description:
Enjoy your favourite music all year round with Classics at Fed Square.
Held in the stunning surrounds of the Deakin Edge, these free monthly concerts offer something for everyone, from classical and swing to big band, jazz and even contemporary pop!
The diverse program includes some of the best local soloists along with big bands from across Victoria. Bring a friend and make a day of it, with free exhibitions at ACMI and The Ian Potter Centre: NGV Australia and plenty of great cafes open for lunch or coffee.

item.title: Lunchtime Meditation
item.description:
Escape the stress and busyness of life and discover the peace of meditation for yourself in these free lunchtime classes.
Your guide, Buddhist Monk Gen Dornying, is the resident teacher at Kadampa Meditation Centre Melbourne.
He teaches with a warmth and humility that you will find is naturally inspiring.
Classes are held in The Atrium at Fed Square.

item.title: Health Qigong
item.description:
Exercise your mind, body and soul with free Qigong classes every Friday morning at Fed Square.
Qigong combines integrated physical movement, mental cultivation and regulated breathing. In traditional Chinese medicine the flow of energy, Qi (Chi) along channels in the body is viewed as central to a person's health and wellbeing, with illness being attributed to restricted or blocked Qi flow.
Learn to regulate your Qi with expert instructors from Tai Chi Australia. You can also join instructors from Tai Chi Australia every Tuesday for free Tai Chi classes at Fed Square.
Suitable for all ages and all fitness levels.

item.title: Spirit of the Square
item.description:
Snow in the middle of the hot Melbourne summer? See it with your own eyes as part of Fed Square's free Christmas program, Spirit of the Square!
Melbourne-based design outfit, Sibling will transform The Square with Whiteout, an installation of large, snow-white, spheres that will pop up throughout The Square, creating an immersive and interactive landscape.
Whiteout is a playful take on the snowy imagery often seen in cinema and TV during the festive season and it will become backdrop to a daily program of free events.
The program of events includes Christmas films, Big Screen Gaming, live music and a resident illustrator who will capture your merriment in sketches for you to take home!
There will also be an Orphans' Christmas on 25 December for fellow Christmas exiles or families looking for a fun place to spend the day. Pull up a deck chair and watch a movie marathon on the Big Screen or take part in a series of games and activities for all ages to enjoy.

item.title: Mansfield District Hospital Carols By Candlelight
item.description: Celebrate the magic of Christmas with song and gather in the tranquil gardens of the Mansfield District Hospital from 7pm and enjoy this very special evening. There will be Christmas gift stalls, glow candles, cold drinks and a sausage sizzle. Carols will begin at 8pm and everyone is welcome. Bring the picnic rug or chair and enjoy this wonderful evening with family and friends. All monies raised goes towards our wonderful hospital.

item.title: Hamilton Wool and Craft Guild
item.description:
The Hamilton Wool and Craft Guild meets every second Monday of each month, excluding the months of December and January, where you can come along and join in with craft including spinning, weaving and felting.
10.30am
All visitors and new members are most welcome to attend.
Please phone prior to confirm your attendance and to answer any questions.

item.title: ISAF Sailing World Cup
item.description:
The official opening for the 2014 ISAF Sailing World Cup - Melbourne will see Chairman Bruce Griffiths welcome competing Olympic athletes and all Invited Classes to the regatta on the first day of the event. The opening ceremony taking place on the balcony of the yacht club will host the official competitor briefing and the all-important flag raising, signalling the event has commenced.
The function coincides with Sail Melbourne's School's Team Racing competition showcasing hundreds of schoolchildren battling it out on the bay, who will then have the incredible chance to meet their Olympic sailing heroes face-to-face.

item.title: Yarraville Festival
item.description: Celebrating its 33rd birthday, the Yarraville Festival boasts local performers, market stalls and art exhibitions for a family-friendly day that brings the unique and quaint Yarraville Village to life. A kids film festival held at the Sun Theatre will be screened on Festival day and a Teddy Bear picnic for the toddlers, free yoga classes, dance workshops and 7 stages of great music!

item.title: Australia Day in Melbourne
item.description: Join in the myriad of celebrations taking place in Melbourne's city centre on Australia Day including the Official Flag Raising Ceremony, the Australia Day March, events in St Kilda Road, Queen Victoria Gardens and Kings Domain Gardens, at the National Gallery of Victoria and conclude the day with celebrations and a spectacular fireworks display at Docklands.

item.title: Kilcunda Lobster Festival
item.description:
Join the Annual Kilcunda Lobster Festival at the Kilcunda foreshore car park for the 31st year of this family friendly event.
The festival runs from 9am to 4pm or until all lobsters are sold. Live music all day, monster raffle, carnival rides and amusements, emergency service displays. Lobster sales and lunches, Chance your luck on the Lobster Spinning Wheel all day or in the monster raffle drawn at 3pm. Hot food and drinks available and loads of market stalls.
A great day for the family down on the coast at Kilcunda. All proceeds to the Kilcunda and local communities. Foreshore car park, Bass Highway, Kilcunda.
All details can be found on the Kilcunda Community Development Association website.

item.title: Villa Maria and Transurban Out & About Family Fun Day
item.description:
You're invited to join Villa Maria's celebration of accessible communities at the Family Fun Day at Albert Park Lake.
The Villa Maria and Transurban Out & About Family Fun Day is set to be a major event, with singer Kate Ceberano, Out & About Ambassador Tim Ferguson and Australian Paralympians lending their hand to support accessible communities.
There will be loads of free all-abilities activities, including a specially designed and built pop-up sensory garden by Swinburne Univesity students, all-abilities sports at the Melbourne Sports and Aquatic Centre and the all-abilities walk around Albert Park Lake. Grab a Mission Possible passport and get activities marked off for your chance to win great prizes.
Don't forget to get involved in the all-abilities Flash Mob. We will soon be launching a video giving a step-by-step guide to the choreography. A rehearsal will also be held a week before the event to make the Flash Mob a huge hit.
With roving entertainers, an animal farm, face painting and a great Aussie sausage sizzle, there's plenty for people of all ages and abilities to do. The Family Fun Day is a wonderful opportunity for Melburnians to enjoy a great day out and show their support for accessible communities. Book the date in your diary now!
The event also promotes Villa Maria's Australian-first accessibility app, Out & About - Accessing your community, which lists accessible venues and events across Melbourne.

image.altText: Out and About Family Fun Day

item.title: Nareen Produce Swap
item.description:
The Nareen Produce Swap is open to anyone who grows their own produce to come along and swap produce for something you don't have in your own garden.
No money changes hands making it a very cost effective way for people to obtain fresh fruit and vegetables.
Don't worry if you haven't got a lot to swap, bring along recopies, jams, flowers and much more.
The Produce Swap is held the last Sunday of each month 10am to 11.30am

item.title: St. Paul's Primary School Bentleigh Fete
item.description:
The St. Paul's Bentleigh Primary School Fete is one of the most popular fetes in the Bayside area.
St. Paul's has held their annual fete for over 25 years, attracting people from all over Melbourne to join in the fun and festivities.
All the favourite stalls will be back trash & treasure, cakes & jams, pre loved toys, clothes & books, gorgeous crafts, devonshire tea, show bags, cupcake decorating, drinks & plenty of food stalls!
Rides include our brand new homemade 'Haunted House", the popular Spinning Wheel, Dunking Machine, Giant Slide, Chair-o-Plane, Harley rides, Cup & Saucer, Rockwall, pony rides and animal nursery.
So grab the kids and join in for some fantastic traditional fete fare fun!
Gates open at 9am

item.title: Australia Day Celebrations Mansfield
item.description:
Bring the family along and celebrate Australia Day in Mansfield.
A fabulous community celebration including a sausage sizzle and live entertainment from 8.30am on the High Street median strip in Mansfield.
Guest speakers will present before the commencement of the Flag Raising Ceremony and presentation of the Mansfield Australia Day Awards.

item.title: Bonnie Doon Country Market & Car Boot Sale
item.description:
The Bonnie Doon Country Market and Car Boot Sales is a delightful country market. Old deciduous trees and the charming atmosphere of country living, invite you to linger at the popular market.
It's held at the Bonnie Doon Community Centre between 8.30am and 1pm and offers a variety of market stalls, including food and great coffee. Come along for breakfast and stay for lunch!
The market is held on a Sunday five times a year, Australia Day Weekend, Easter Sunday, Queen's Birthday weekend, last weekend in September school holidays and Melbourne Cup weekend.

item.title: Australia Day 2015
item.description:
Australia Day ceremonies occurring across the Shire include flag raising, guest speakers, presentations, entertainment and community barbecues. Members of the public can attend the Southern Grampians Shire Council Australia Day Celebrations to be held on Sunday 26th January 2015, at the Hamilton Botanic Gardens.
The official program will commence at 10.30am with presentations of Australia Day Awards, Address from Australia Day Ambassador, flag raising, Citizenship Ceremony and musical items. A free barbecue will be provided by the Hamilton Lions Club at the conclusion of the function.
Other celebrations will be taking place across the Shire.

item.title: Hamilton Country Fair 2014
item.description:
Gray Street Primary school invites you to their Country Fair this spring.
Featuring the Great Victorian Jam & Chutney Challenge, homemade food stalls, 30 undercover stalls, kids rides, amusements, show bags, an animal farm, car displays, a haunted house, live music, fairy floss, kid's activities, books, plants, preserves, toys and so much more.
Time: 11am - 4.00pm

image.altText: Gray Street Primary School Country Fair
Gray Street Primary School Country Fair

item.title: Penshurst Christmas Market
item.description:
Penshurst is set at the base of Mount Rouse in Western Victoria, in a region rich on Volcanic history 30kms from Hamilton.
Looking for last minute Christmas presents, or something special for someone special...
Shop for Christmas at the Penshurst Christmas Market. There is sure to be something for everyone!
New stall holders welcome.
Time: 6.00pm - 9.00pm

item.title: Mansfield High Country Festival Grand Parade
item.description: The Rotary Grand Parade is a family affair. Favourites like bagpipes, clowns, horses and an amazing display of ingeniously designed floats will add to the carnival atmosphere of a town transformed and in Festival mode. This is a true community event with over 300 people participating. See Mansfield dress up, show off and parade along High Street.

item.title: Pako Festa A Celebration of Cultural Diversity
item.description:
Pako Festa, now in its thirty-second year, is Geelong's much loved, award-winning, free annual community cultural festival - the biggest of its kind in Australia.
Managed by Diversitat and held on the last weekend of February in Pakington Street, Geelong West, "the multicultural heart of Geelong", it incorporates an extravagant street parade featuring around ninety floats and hundreds of performers representing forty-five affiliated ethnic communities and around sixty other community groups and organisations.
The street is lined with stalls selling traditional foods and arts and crafts, and nine separate stages in the precinct offer performances of music and dance as well as interactive workshops and exhibitions. Pako Festa has become one of Victoria's premier multicultural event, attended by well over 100,000 people in each of the last three years
Visit the website for full program and to download the Pako Festa event application.

item.title: Mansfield Bush Market
item.description:
Mansfield Bushmarket is a must do whilst in visiting!
One of the largest and most popular Bush markets offering just about everything you could imagine.
Local produce such as fresh breads, cakes, fruit & vegetables, nuts, seeds, jams, preserves & olives just to mention a few.
There will be a number of local wines for tasting & purchase, art & craft, plants, clothing, gifts and much more. There will be numerous food and refreshment options available.

item.title: Makers Market Abbotsford
item.description:
The Abbotsford Makers Market is a not for profit association supporting and showcasing the diversity and excellence of local artisans and crafters.
All items are handmade original designs and include photography, textiles, print, wood, ceramic, jewellery, sculpture, paper, glass, clothing, toys, home decor and more. Food stalls are also a regular addition to the market with cupcakes, biscuits, fudge and much more available to nibble on!
The market is held indoors on the third Sunday of every month in the main Convent building at the Abbotsford Convent.
The Convent is an exciting arts precinct situated by the Yarra and the Collingwood Children's Farm. Surrounded by beautiful gardens, the Convent's historic buildings are full of studios, galleries, meeting and workshop spaces plus a choice of excellent eating places.

item.title: Naturally Loddon - Wedderburn Naturally New Age Festival and Farmers Market
item.description:
The Wedderburn Naturally New Age Festival and Farmers Market have a diverse range of stalls this year; jewellery, crystals, clairvoyant readings, palm readings, astrology, handmade products, soap, sculpture, Shamanic healing, crystal balancing, Reiki, a variety of baked goods, hot and cold foods and much, much more.
This year they have aimed to bring a real family, kid friendly atmosphere to this event as well as catering for grown up spiritual seeking.
The kid's entertainment includes a covered, supervised jumping castle, Red the Clown, who will perform magic acts, balloon art and other acts to entertain the whole family. Our face painter will turn your kids into butterfly's, tigers or whatever they want, for a small fee.
Musicians will rove, providing musical accompaniment to the delicious food that will be available. Lamine Sonko, African Culture Keeper and his African band will entertain us all and include us with drum and dancing workshops. Other workshops will be announced on the day.
The Wedderburn Naturally New Age Festival and Farmers Market are looking forward to an extremely successful festival again and in conjunction with our inaugural Farmers Markets, the place should be really rocking.
Wedderburn Lions Club are providing a barbecue.

item.title: Coal Creek Pirates Day
item.description:
Looking for something to do during the school holidays or just enjoy dressing up, then Coal Creek has another fun-packed day for the family!
Enjoy a treasure hunt for all pirate, magic and balloon show, boat races at the lake - buy and decorate your boat, then enter your boat at the lake to see if your pirate ship wins the race and competitions for the best dressed pirate.
As part of the annual Pirates Day celebrations at Coal Creek, Gippsland Gamers will be running the following amazing stuff: In the middle of the Seas of Skullduggery - Skeleton Island, hiding place of Cap'n Rumblebelly's buried treasure! Around the outside of the sea, the islands of six pirate kings desperate to get their hands on the treasure! Take command of one of the pirate's ships and try to get to Skeleton Island first to dig up the treasure, and then get it back to your own island to claim it forever! But beware, five other pirates have the same idea as you, and even if you get the treasure, you might not be able to hang onto it!
Pirates Treasure is an exciting game of skill for young children. Using toy pirate ships, batons and thrown dice for cannon balls, the game is both fast and fun! Cap'n Rumblebelly's fabulous buried horde of chocolate money is at stake - may the best buccaneer win!
item.ns0:organiser: Coal Creek Community Park and Museum

item.title: Diwali Indian Festival of Light
item.description:
Experience the charms of Indian culture at the Diwali Festival of Light 2014 at Fed Square.
Each year, Fed Square comes to life with diverse stalls and activities exploring the different traditions, cuisines and crafts of India.
Savour the tastes of authentic Indian food with an array of food stalls, admire delicate hand-made Indian jewellery and fine fashion and unwind with a great range of Indian cinema and music. There will also be demonstrations of traditional Henna painting and classical Indian and Bollywood dance performances and workshops.
While Diwali is commonly referred to as the 'festival of lights', for Hindus it is actually about celebrating inner light and the belief that good will triumph over evil.
Don't miss this beautiful festival renowned for its brilliant displays of fireworks and hundreds of glittering lamps to light up the 'darkness'.

item.title: Maldon Market: Handmade, Home grown
item.description:
The new Maldon Market is a monthly growers and makers market that brings together the very best hand made products and hand grown produce from the creative and fertile heart of Victoria, as well as emerging Melbourne talent.
From soap to soup, fruit to furniture, plants to pants, jewellery to jumpers, the Maldon Market has something for everyone.
The market will feature: gourmet take away food and great coffee; live music; kids entertainment and playground; beautiful gardens to relax in; historic township to explore; hand made arts, crafts, jewellery, clothes, home grown fruit, vegetables, plants and other produce.

ns0:venue.name: Historic township of Maldon, Central Vic

item.title: Tolmie Craft & Farmers Market
item.description:
Take a scenic and relaxing drive out to Tolmie for their monthly Craft and Farmers Market.
Enjoy great coffee and breaky! Purchase locally grown produce and locally made products at the Tolmie Recreation Reserve, approximately 20 minutes drive from Mansfield.
The market is held on the third Saturday of each month during Spring Summer and Autumn.
For Stall holder enquiries please call Marg on 03 5776 2231.
Tolmie looks forward to welcoming you.

item.title: Oxley Bush Market
item.description:
Staged at the historic Oxley Shire Hall (1875), the annual Oxley Bush market is timed to coincide with the Wangaratta Festival of Jazz and Blues.
Thousands of visitors flock to Oxley for this annual event and wander among the 165 stalls boasting a variety of home-made, home-produced, home-grown and new items. Widely regarded as the premier bush market in country Victoria, the event attracts stallholders from throughout the North East, as well as all corners of Victoria and southern New South Wales. Over and above the enormous range of high quality goods on sale, visitors will be delighted by the variety of gourmet food on offer, the buskers, the rides and just the sheer activity and vibrancy of the event.
The Oxley market is also valued for the contribution it makes to many local fundraising groups, including schools, kindergartens, service clubs, fire brigades, the Cancer Council and the Royal Children's Hospital Auxiliary.
No dogs allowed.

item.title: Bonjour Bright
item.description:
Enjoy the French influenced festival in Howitt Park, Bright with open air films, live music, food and wine as an accompaniment to the Audax Alpine Classic. There is plenty of kids entertainment on offer throughout the weekend and a range of artists and musicians.
Free admission.
More information released closer to the event.

item.title: Castlemaine Farmers Market
item.description:
The Castlemaine Farmers' Market located in beautiful Victory Park in the centre of historic Castlemaine has more than 50 quality stallholders showcasing produce from Central Victoria.
The Market sells locally grown and made produce and is accredited with the Victorian Farmers Market Association.
The charter of accredited Farmers Markets is to support local producers and to encourage consumers to buy local.
Held on the first Sunday of each month, except January, the Castlemaine Farmes Market is the place meet friends, enjoy great coffee and fabulous food and stock up on delicious fresh produce.

item.title: Mansfield CWA Produce & Craft Market
item.description: Enjoy an opportunity to purchase fresh produce and some great locally home made goodies with funds going to the Mansfield CWA Group - Wonderful selection of cakes and crafts, produce and preserves with morning tea available. Held 2nd Saturday throughout the year. Located at the CWA Hall in High Street, Mansfield from 10am-2pm

item.title: Point Nepean Portsea Market
item.description:
From the operators of the famous Red Hill Market comes a new quality arts crafts and gourmet food market down by the sea at the Quarantine Station, Point Nepean near Portsea.
Soak in the exceptional atmosphere and regenerate your senses at this delightful market. There is something for everyone from old-world to modern contemporary, a labyrinth of unique treasures worth discovering. No dogs are allowed in the National Park.

item.title: Yarra Glen Racecourse Market
item.description:
Yarra Glen Racecourse Market is a quality arts crafts and gourmet food market.
The Yarra Glen Racecourse Market is returning to its original home on the first Sunday on the month from October to June - 9am to 2pm. Nestled in the heart of the beautiful Yarra Valley is the picturesque Yarra Glen racecourse, home to the Yarra Glen Racecourse Market. Beautiful country vistas, wide walkways, leafy surrounds and ample parking available make this venue the perfect destination for a day out with the family.
Just an hour's drive from Melbourne, the market is a great outdoor shopping experience, perfect for picking some fresh produce or tasting some delicious food and wines. This market held on the first Sunday of every month from October to June. Within this refreshing outdoor environment, you'll need some time to browse the many quality stalls offering only Australian made items. Shoppers can also purchase stylish insulated CMA shopping bags to store their selections.
Whether you're looking for a really different hand made gift, something uniquely beautiful for the home or the freshest gourmet foods and produce, you're bound to find it at our market. And when you are need a break from shopping, there are plenty of home made take away food options to try and ideal picnic spots to rest and enjoy live music and plenty of entertainment for the kids. Make the most of your Yarra Valley visit by adding a stop off at the market for an amazing shopping and dining experience.

item.title: Hanging Rock Market
item.description:
Hanging Rock is a quality arts, crafts and gourmet food market.
Now you can enjoy more than a picnic at Hanging Rock, Craft Markets Australia will host two special craft and produce markets at this well known tourism icon yearly. Visitors can expect to find an excellent variety of both local and regional stalls offering quality Australian made products, delicious gourmet foods and fresh home grown produce.
The Macedon Ranges are less than an hour's drive from Melbourne along the Calder Freeway and only half that time from Melbourne's Tullamarine Airport. Hanging Rock is easily accessed from the A79 Calder Freeway which passes by on the eastern side of Woodend or via Mt Macedon or from the M31 Hume Highway by turning off at Kilmore and travelling through Lancefield, or alternatively from Wallan via Romsey. There's ample parking, great public amenities and easy walking

item.title: Red Hill Community Market
item.description:
Red Hill is the 'grand dame' of Victoria's craft markets.
Soak in the exceptional atmosphere and regenerate your senses at one of the delightful markets. There is something for everyone from old world to modern contemporary, a labyrinth of unique treasures worth discovering. Dedicated commitment to quality brings together over 300 talented stallholders who regularly demonstrate enormous pride in their work by producing original creations of the highest quality. It is a proven feast for the mind, body and soul, a fascinating eclectic mix of textures, materials and colours that make up the vast range of individually designed products.
There is little doubt that on the first Saturday of the month between 8am and 1pm, the Red Hill Community Market is the place to be.

item.title: Flemington Racecourse Market
item.description:
The Flemington Racecourse Market is a quality arts, crafts and gourmet food market. We didn't think it was fair that city people had to travel so far every month to experience the best that the country had to offer, so in 1996 we decided to take the country to the city.
Flemington Racecourse Market provides the best of regional Victorian produce and craft work just around the corner for millions of Melburnians. With the resources of the Flemington Racecourse at our disposal, parking space is never a problem. Join us every month to discover many wonderful treats guaranteed to stimulate your senses!

item.title: Mornington Racecourse Market
item.description:
Mornington Racecourse Market is a quality arts crafts and gourmet food market.
Mornington is one of the Peninsula's most appealing coastal towns and its famous Racecourse Market has been a monthly highlight since 1994. The well treed site provides shade in summer and protection in the colder months. There is an undercover area as well, but regardless of the weather, thousands of regular market-goers always keep the second Sunday of every month as their 'Mornington day'. When the market is over, the town's boutique shops and coastal pleasures completes a great day's outing.

item.title: Upwelling Festival Portland
item.description:
The Upwelling Festival in Portland offers a fantastic and vibrant way for visitors and Portland locals to celebrate and showcase the unique eco-tourism features of the beautiful coastal town, the Bonney Upwelling.
The Bonney Upwelling is a seven month long natural ocean occurrence where krill form dense swarms up to a kilometre in length. These exceptional feeding conditions trigger a feeding frenzy of whales, seals, giant crabs, tuna, crayfish, squid, fish and seabirds.
The Festival includes the Blessing of the Fleet, street parade, festival markets, local entertainment, marine environment talks, whale boat races along with community art projects on the foreshore.
The Festival is run in conjunction with two other well-established and popular local events - the Rotary Art Show (all weekend) and the Portland Three Bays Marathon (Sunday morning). Together these events provide a weekend-long program of activities for locals and visitors.

item.title: SpringFest Market Weekend
item.description:
This year's 14th annual Springfest Season of Events remains the Rotary Club of Ballarat's largest fundraising initiative. Events kick off in August with a trivia night, corporate dinner, raffle and harness racing night and culminate in Springfest Market Weekend.
Every year thousands of people flock to Lake Wendouree's foreshore for Market Sunday, with 350 stallholders on show from across Victoria and beyond. Now, with dragon-boat racing, an outrigger canoe regatta and an International Festival on the Saturday, the once one-day event has grown to a two-day festival.

item.title: Benalla Lakeside Craft & Farmers Market
item.description:
Market stalls, food and entertainment for the whole family. Held beside beautiful Lake Benalla on the 4th Saturday of each month.
Come along and browse the great range of stalls, grab a coffee, try and wine and a delicious snack and listen to a diverse range of music performed by local talent.

item.title: 17th Winter Miracles Orchid show
item.description:
The Yarra Valley Orchid Society Plant and Orchid Fair features a variety of Orchids grown by orchid enthusiasts from clubs located in Victoria.
Orchids and plant collectables are available for purchase from the vendors present, including Australian Native and exotic Orchids, Clivias, ferns, bromeliads & plant collectables.
Refreshments are available at nominal prices. Advice is freely available to new or novice growers on the nuances of orchid cultivation and there will be plants for sale.

item.title: Rutherglen Farmers Market
item.description:
Rutherglen Farmers Market has over 25 local and regional producers offering extensive range of fresh produce for sale.
A diverse range of products have been assembled by market organisers that will include; fresh seasonal fruit and vegetables, olive, olive oils, honeys, freshly baked sweets, plants and native flowers and much more.
Once thing is guaranteed that it will be an absolute feast for the taste buds!
Rutherglen Lions Club put on a delicious breakfast of bacon and eggs rolls or a sausage in bread
The Market operates monthly on the second Sunday of every month in the Lions Park, Rutherglen.

item.title: Euroa Village Farmers Market
item.description:
Come along and support the Euroa Village Farmers' Market, proudly presented by the Rotary Club with the support of the Strathbogie Shire Council & the State Government of Victoria.
Proudly accredited with the Victorian Farmers Markets Association, the Euroa Village Farmers' Market was created to enable regional producers to connect regularly with the local community in a vibrant central setting.
The market features around 30 stalls of fresh fruits, vegetables & herbs in season alongside a fantastic selection of meats - boer goat, pork, lamb & beef, honey, free-range eggs, olive products, Strathbogie region wines, nuts, native plants, exotic plants, sweet treats, quality preserves, organic sourdough breads, fresh cut flowers, heirloom seedlings, live poultry (in season), handmade pasta, farmhouse cheeses & much much more! Check out our stallholder list for more information.
Lunch is available; community barbecue, gourmet local sausages - Our Own Premium Meat of Shepparton, wood fired pizza with local ingredients, great coffee, sweet treats from the renowned Ruffy Produce Store and more. Devonshire Teas featuring fabulous local preserves are available from the U3A kitchen, adjacent to the market.
The market has a truly delightful site by The Seven Creeks, complete with the lush melodies of live entertainment from local musicians.
Please bring your bags, baskets and trolleys.
Dogs are welcome on a leash.
See you there!
item.ns0:organiser: Rotary Club of Euroa, Meggs Hannes, Coordinator

item.title: 2014 Falls Creek Ice Plunge
item.description:
Join Falls Creek locals as they take a winter plunge into Rocky Valley Dam to celebrate the first day of winter to pay homage to the snow gods for a good snow season.
All entrants receive a token gift to commemorate their bravery plus there will be great prizes and giveaways for those who make the plunge in fancy dress!
As always, the Falls Creek SES will be on hand with a fund-raising barbecue to warm you up.

item.title: Primrose Fair
item.description:
The Primrose Fair is a shopping paradise and will be held at the historic Cloisters of Toorak College. It will be a spectacular shopping event with 60 stalls located in the cloisters of Toorak College and the Design Pavilion.
The first market on the new year will be held on Saturday, 1 March 2014.
Visit the website for full program details.

item.title: Wodonga Carols by Candlelight
item.description:
Bring a chair, relax, have a picnic and sing along while you enjoy this traditional outdoor concert.
Free family entertainment provided by local artists, Wodonga Brass and the Sing Australia Choir. The event will be broadcast on 1494 2AY.
A full program supplement will appear in the Border Mail.
Local groups will provide pre carols entertainment from 6.00pm so come along and enjoy a picnic in the park prior to the main event.

item.title: Australian Mounted Games Association
item.description:
Held at Wentworth Showgrounds, Mounted Games are a series of very fast races, exciting for participants and spectators alike, performed by people on ponies.
They require a high degree of athletic ability, good riding skills, hand-to-eye coordination, general determination to see things through to the end no matter what, and a competitive spirit which nevertheless requires an ability to work together with other riders and to be willing to help one another.
The Mounted Games community is a large family! As such, there is healthy good-natured rivalry on the field of play, but great cooperation between players off the field regarding matters of the games as well as those of personal relationships and logistics.
Mounted Games were the inspiration of H.R.H. Prince Philip. When Col. Sir Mike Ansell was Director of the Horse of the Year Show, Prince Philip asked if he could devise a competition for children who could not afford an expensive, well-bred pony, and in 1957 the Horse of the Year Show, then at Harringay Arena, staged the first Mounted Games Championship for the Prince Philip Cup - it was an immediate box office success.

item.title: Milawa Gourmet Region Producers Market
item.description:
Milawa Gourmet Region have a producers market at the beginning of each season. The market showcases the beautiful produce produced in North East Victoria which a chance for the public to meet the producers.
The market also features live music and craft items.
It's a great day out for the family, so come down to the next market and see what great produce you can find.

item.title: Moyhu Farmers & Community Market
item.description:
Celebrating the best of the King Valley's Produce and its vibrant community, the Moyhu Farmers and Community Market is a fantastic event for the locals and visitors alike.
Browse the stalls for espresso coffee, hot farmers breakfast, plants, fresh local fruit and vegetables, handmade preserves and jams, bread, local meat producers, seasonal produce and more.

item.title: Sunraysia Farmers Market
item.description:
Sunraysia Farmers Market provides the platform that links good food direct from the regions genuine producers with community.
Indulge the senses, taste, wander and unwind as you discover a range of superb fresh fruit, vegetables and herbs; freshly brewed coffee, wine, olive oil, preserves and condiments; eggs, honey, grains and nuts; freshly baked bread, pastries and cakes plus meat and smallgoods and so much more.
Take the time to enjoy breakfast made from the market's produce under the giant river gums beside the Murray River. There is plenty of parking, pathways and flat ground and with the playgrounds nearby, it's perfect for families.
Sunraysia Farmers Market is temporarily at Jaycee Park, Hugh King Drive Mildura until redevelopment of Ornamental Lakes, Hugh King Drive Mildura is complete.

item.title: Tai Chi at Fed Square
item.description:
Start each week feeling refreshed, rejuvenated and energised with Tai Chi, the Chinese martial art that promotes health and relaxation.
Join expert instructors from Tai Chi Australia for a free class every Tuesday morning in the heart of Melbourne city - Fed Square.
Exercise your mind, body and soul in this inspiring location.

item.title: Scots Day Out
item.description:
Held at Rosalind Park in Bendigo, the Scots Day Out will be a day filled with fun.
Activities on the day include:
- Colourful parade down View St to Rosalind Park, Pipe bands (bands from across the state will be part of the Victorian Highland Pipe Band Association competition, the first band contest for 2013) - Highland dancers will compete in the inaugural Central Victoria Highland Dancing Classic - A warm-up for the Australian Commonwealth Championships - Scottish country dancers from Bendigo and central Victoria will give displays throughout the day - Emu Creek Bush Band will play Celtic folk music throughout the day - Clans will set up tents with displays on Scottish family history - Stalls selling Scottish goods and offering haggis and whisky tastings - Scottish story telling for families - Swordplay - A spectacular finale at 4.30pm featuring Scots Day Out participants

item.title: Bright Spring Festival
item.description:
The Bright Spring Festival showcases what the Bright & Surrounds is all about; great cafes and restaurants, access to many wineries, accommodation to suit all budgets, adventure sports, walking tracks and trails, street and river markets, art exhibitions and the natural beauty of the Ovens and Kiewa Valleys, not found elsewhere in Victoria.
Events include: -Workshops and classes -Open garden displays -Myrtleford Agricultural and Pastoral Show -Oktoberfest -Spring garden feast -Grand firework spectacular and concert -Monster Rotary market

item.title: Piers Festival
item.description:
The Piers Festival will bring the Port Melbourne piers precinct to life with a spectacular display of music, dance, markets, exhibitions, forums and more. This colourful celebration of Melbourne's diversity will link in with Victoria's Australia Day activities and highlight the state's rich history of migration.
The event is free, family friendly and will culminate with fireworks.

image.altText: Chinese Lion Dance at Piers Festival
Chinese Lion Dance at Piers Festival
Lamine Sonko and the African Intelligence at Piers Festival
Lamine Sonko and the African Intelligence at Piers Festival
Manasis Greek Dance at Piers Festival
Manasis Greek Dance at Piers Festival

item.title: Beechworth Golden Horseshoes Festival
item.description:
Beechworth comes alive at Easter with a Grand Street Parade, street stalls and entertainment, carnival rides and a massive Easter egg hunt. View the re-enactment of the horse with the golden horseshoes riding into Beechworth.
A weekend packed with activities all weekend with markets, family bike ride and mountain bike racing. There is something to keep everyone entertained this Easter in Beechworth.

item.title: Car Club Showcase
item.description:
See your favourite cars up close and meet the proud owners at the Fed Square Car Club Showcase - a free monthly motor show in the heart of Melbourne.
On the last Sunday of every month car aficionados transform the Flinders Street frontage of Federation Square into the most glamorous car park in town. Classic cars one month, vintage the next and modern sports cars another. All lovingly restored and cared for.

item.title: Merbein Street Market
item.description:
The vibrant Merbein Street Market is held on the third Sunday of every month.
On sale you will find crafts, clothing and fresh produce, as well as homemade jams, pickles and dried fruit, jewellery, natural beauty products, books, plants, woodwork items, bric-a-brac and locally made boomerangs and didgeridoos.
The event is managed by Loddon-Mallee Region Girl Guides.

item.title: Cycling Australia Road National Championships
item.description:
Be in Ballarat in early January to witness a world-class field of Australia's greatest cycling starts battle it out for the green and gold Australian jersey at the 2015 Cycling Australia Road National Championships.
The 2015 program will feature three major disciplines - Criterium, Time Trial and Road Race for Men U/23, Elite Women and Elite Men.
The Nationals provide an opportunity to witness four days of high class cycling action. Specifically, the Buninyong road circuit is regarded as one of the top road racing circuits in Australia.

image.altText: King of the Mountain in Buninyong
King of the Mountain in Buninyong

item.title: Fed Square Book Market
item.description:
Love books? Then join Melbourne's bibliophiles at the Fed Square Book Market, one of the largest weekly book markets in Melbourne, in The Atrium at Fed Square.
Each week you can immerse yourself in over 5000 new and pre-loved titles, including literature, history, gardening, travel, art and kids stories.
The Book Market regularly features around fifteen of Melbourne's most experienced book dealers as well as authors and illustrators.

item.title: Melbourne Design Market
item.description:
Why is the Melbourne Design Market so wonderful? It's original, fun, and full of new products that everyone loves to see and buy - and in 2014 the Melbourne Design Market celebrate their 10th anniversary!
Occupying a special place in everyone's diary, the market is now held twice a year in July and November. Thousands of visitors are drawn to its car-park location at Melbourne's Federation Square, transformed for each occasion into a design show that features the latest in fashion, homewares, furniture, lighting and so much more.
There are many recognisable brands at the market; still more make use of the Melbourne Design Market as a launching pad for new enterprises.
Meet the designers, enjoy fine food and coffee, and be part of the Melbourne Design Market's own style in fostering and promoting design.

item.title: Frankston's Christmas Festival of Lights
item.description:
Bring together your family and friends and create your magical family memory at Frankston's Christmas Festival of Lights 2014.
Santa and Mrs Claus will join your host, Brodie Harper, to start the evening as Davey Street and the Frankston Arts Centre is once again transformed into an enchanted land of fun and fantasy.
Look for Santa and Mrs Claus as they embark on their journey through the city centre to the festival site, be a part of the parade and excitement of Santa's Grand Arrival and help sing 'Santa Claus is coming to town'.
Free live entertainment, arts and crafts, market and pop-up stalls, rides and amusements and much more are on the menu and as the event celebrates its 17th year this is a wonderful opportunity to bring family and friends together and celebrate the spirit of community.
Including Sesame Street - 'Elmo and Friends' live on stage, Captain Barnacles from the Octonauts and a special performance from The Voice Australia' Harrison Craig, followed by the family favourite tree lighting ceremony and fireworks display, this is a night not-to-be-missed.
Be captivated by the sounds of Christmas and create your magical family memory at Frankston's Christmas Festival of Lights in an evening guaranteed to inspire the hearts and imaginations of the young and young at heart.

item.title: St. Michael's Annual Cup Day Fair
item.description:
Join in for a fun day for the whole family at St. Michael's Cup Day Fair.
There's a trash and treasure market, cakes and jams, food court, Devonshire teas, arts and crafts, plants, books, silent auction, toys, bouncy castle and much more.
Check out the website for details or call Peter on 0413009413.
Head up to the beautiful Dandenong's and join the St. Michael's Community in celebrating the Melbourne Cup Day holiday.

address.address1: Cnr. Mt. Dandenong Tourist & Falls Roads

item.title: Warragul Arts Market
item.description:
The Warragul Arts Market is held in beautiful Civic Park, where visitors can meet the artists, participate and be entertained by local performers, purchase unique creations and be inspired!
Artist run stalls and demonstrating artists, enjoy live music and even participate in free hands on creative arts activities.
The market runs on the third Saturday of the month, from October to March only and is held on the same day and location as the Warragul Farmers Market.

item.title: Daylesford Macedon Ranges Open Studios
item.description:
Thirty-five artists from the beautiful Daylesford and Macedon Ranges region will open their studios for six days in November, giving the public a chance to go 'behind the scenes' of the creative process, meet the artists in their creative spaces, and learn about their work and inspiration.
The Daylesford and Macedon Ranges Open Studios is based on the famous Cambridge Open Studios event, and will showcase some of its extraordinary artists. Visit the Group Exhibition in the historic St Pauls' Church Hall to preview the artist's work before calling at their studios in the little towns and villages across the region, such as Gisborne, Mt Macedon, Newham, Woodend, Kyneton, Malmsbury, Trentham, Glen Lyon, Wheatsheaf, Lyonville, Musk, Daylesford, Hepburn Springs, Basalt and Yandoit.
